title: Graphic Designer / Frontend Developer (Part-Time)
description:
**About Us ☀️** 




  





 At Lolo we're building programmable network infrastructure. Our platform gives enterprises, OEMs, and device manufacturers full control over data, devices, and connectivity—powering use cases like OTA, data fencing, and fleet operations.
 



  





 We are currently collaborating with a reputable agency to flex-out our brand and initial web presence for coming into the public eye. To help us cover our bases we’re looking for a versatile creative to join in and be part of realizing that vision.
 



  





**Who we are looking for 🔎** 




  





 We're looking to hire a pragmatic junior creative, some sort of hybrid designer/developer to help us evolve and maintain our website, digital presence and visual identity. The person should be comfortable taking direction and focus on usefulness and iteration over perfection.
 



  





 Attitude will be more important than having a specific degree or a bunch of experience. Being comfortable to ask questions if you are unsure is also important. You’ll mostly work with our web and help us roll out content cohesive to our visual system.
 



  





 The person who will succeed in this role is scrappy and understands that we build what is needed, not what is fun to make. Engineering for the sake of engineering is not the vibe.
 



  





**What we can offer 🎁** 




  





 This role will start as half-time and we are very open to you doing it while studying, we're pretty flexible for the right person. If all goes well the ambition is to transition this to a full-time contract within a year or so.
 



  





 This is an opportunity to join early and be part of the creation and development of a long-lasting site and materials for a startup in a growth phase. As we are a small team of senior people, this means the exposure to strategic topics and learning curve will be steep.
 



  





**Responsibilities 📚** 




  




* Co-own updates and improvements to the website
* Implement new pages and components based on product messaging
* Create and adapt brand assets: diagrams, illustrations, social media, decks
* Ensure design consistency across web, docs, presentations, and product previews
* Assist with basic content edits or copy blocks



  





**Requirements 🌈** 




  




* Experience & interest in graphic design and frontend development
* Solid command of JS, HTML, CSS, and familiarity with some modern frameworks
* Some designs to show how you see web development (can be hobby projects, just want to understand how you approach problems)
* Experience with Figma, Adobe Creative Suite or other visual asset tool
* Clear understanding of responsive layout, or willingness to learn
* Comfortable translating abstract ideas
* Content or copywriting instincts



  





**Tools you'll likely use 🛠️** 




  




* Figma, Illustrator
* Sanity CMS, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Next.js
* GitHub, Confluence



  





**Details 🦋** 




  





 Office: Lindetorpsvägen 25, hybrid-remote
 



 Scope: 50% i.e. 20 hours/week
 



 Salary: 18.000 SEK/month (should be aligned with CSN guidelines, but up to you to doublecheck)
 



 Perks: Fun colleagues, technically complex product, cool merch, and other stuff
 



  





 Please email your application to: careers@lolo.company

title: Senior FullStack Engineer with Frontend focus
description:
**Our Company**
 Keystone is one of the leading organizations to help students find the right education to pursue their dreams. While for education providers, Keystone offers end-to-end solutions across the entire student recruitment value chain.
   

  

 Backed by leading Nordic venture firms Viking Venture and Verdane, Keystone has an international staff of around 800+ employees spread across 15 countries around the globe, including the UK, Norway, Spain, Sweden and Germany.
   

  

**About the job:**
 As a Senior Full-stack Developer in our growing team, you will become part of an environment where collaboration, team spirit and personal responsibility are highly valued. The position offers challenging tasks and good development opportunities. You will be joining one of our development squads and drive the evolution and improvement of our products. You will support your colleagues and help them to develop by means of code reviews, knowledge sharing sessions and individual coaching. You will evaluate alternative technologies to support growth and increase efficiency. You will write great code that continuously raises the bar of what good looks like.
   

  

**What technologies do we work with?**
* React / Next.js
* Latest versions of .NET, C# and ASP.NET MVC
* Data storage technologies like AWS Aurora, DynamoDB, etc.
* Sanity.io
* Elasticsearch and Redis
* Amazon Web Services (AWS)


**Who are we looking for?**
* At least 6 years experience as a full-stack developer.
* Strong experience with React / Next.js.
* Good knowledge of .NET Framework and .NET Core.
* Good knowledge about Rest API, GraphQL, Entity Framework, and different test frameworks.
* Enjoys working in dynamic and autonomous teams.
* Willingness to share knowledge with the team and bravely dive into new technical as well as functional territories.
* A great passion for building and delivering top notch products to our customers.
* Meriting but not required, knowledge of Cloud computing on AWS and its serverless offerings.


**What can we offer you?**
* Ability to work with cutting-edge technologies in exciting projects.
* Opportunity to work with a large-scale cloud-hosted solution.
* Freedom to help, plan and lead system architecture decisions in a fast-growing company.
* An international work environment with colleagues from all over the world.
* Plenty of opportunities to grow within the organization.
* Possibility to learn and educate through seminars, knowledge sharing sessions, relevant Tech conferences and our exciting Hackathon events.
* Monday breakfast, regular team lunches, Friday beer, team activities and fun events.
* Hybrid work setup.


**About The Team**
 The engineering team is based in Stockholm and Sheffield. The responsibilities of the team encompass developing technical platforms and solutions to lay the ground for the rest of the business at Keystone Education Group. We are a rapidly growing company that is now looking for new talents to strengthen our team. Read more about us here: https://www.keg.com/
   

  

 Do you want to join our family? Please send us your application by hitting the button "Apply here!". We are looking for someone who can start as soon as possible in our Stockholm office.
   

  

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Senior Lead Developer - Frontend
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Leda design, utveckling och underhåll av högkvalitativa webb- och mobilapplikationer med React och React Native.
* Ansvara för frontend-arkitektur, säkerställa best practices kring prestanda, tillgänglighet och underhåll.
* Driva och facilitera diskussioner kring UI/UX-design.
* Coachning, mentorering och stöd till teammedlemmar i deras tekniska utveckling och professionella tillväxt.
* Implementera och underhålla återanvändbara komponentbibliotek och designsystem.
* Arbeta nära backend-utvecklare, designers, produktägare och QA-team för att leverera sammanhängande lösningar.
* Främja best practices inom frontend-utveckling, inklusive testning, kodgranskningar och principer för clean code.
* Identifiera och lösa arkitektur- och prestandautmaningar för att säkerställa att frontend-applikationerna är skalbara och användarvänliga.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 7 års erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling med starkt fokus på React.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av React Native för mobilapputveckling.
* Bevisad erfarenhet av att arkitektera komplexa frontend-lösningar för webb och mobil.
* Djup förståelse för JavaScript, TypeScript och moderna byggprocesser för frontend.
* Stark erfarenhet av state management-bibliotek som Redux, Zustand, Recoil eller liknande.
* God förståelse för REST API:er och GraphQL-integrationer.
* Erfarenhet av frontend-testning med ramverk som Jest, React Testing Library, Detox etc.
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga och ett proaktivt ledarskap i en dynamisk miljö.
* Erfarenhet av mobilapputveckling för iOS och Android är meriterande.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 12-05-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Baseband L1 Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity!**
 Are you ready to shape the future of 5G?
   

  

 Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a L1 Software Developer to join our outstanding team in Kista. In this role, you’ll be working on our 5G/6G RAN L1 Software product, playing a key role in ensuring its performance and success.
   

  

 J
 **oin us at the forefront of wireless innovation!**
**What You Will Do**
**As a member of the L1 team, you’ll shape system architecture, implement key features, and ensure high-performance deployment. Your focus will be on the Physical Layer (L1) components of Baseband software—core building blocks of our leading 5G RAN solutions and future 6G technologies** 
 .
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Collaborate with engineers to design/systemize, develop, and maintain software components essential to product functionality.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
* Work within a dynamic, agile development environment to meet timelines and goals.


**Skills You Bring**
* Passion and interest in design, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and a solid and proven expertise in embedded software design.
* Expertise in multi-core architectures and real-time systems.
* Domain knowledge in wireless communications, especially in signal processing, 4G/5G NR Physical Layer functions (highly desirable).
* Strong collaboration skills – thrive in international, multi-site teams; open communicator with a proactive, can-do attitude.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, agile environments; committed to delivering high-quality software on time.
* A drive for innovation – proactive mindset for continuous improvement in development practices.
* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communications, or a related field.
* Relevant experience, 2–6 years in embedded software development, ideally in telecom or a related industry


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]

title: Embedded SW Developer
description:
**Grow with us**
**About this opportunity:**
 Radio & Transport Engineering strives to be the most competitive Radio Network R&D unit in the industry. We work in an agile set-up to develop and maintain competitive, high-quality Radio products which give our customer solutions securing future growth.
   

  

 Control Software is part of the Radio & Transport Engineering (RTE) within Business Area Networks (BNEW). We are based in Kista, Stockholm. We also have a close corporation with development of Radio products in Ottawa, Beijing, Nanjing, Chengdu, Lund and Zagreb.
   

  

 Control Software provides possibility to work with the latest technology within telecommunication development. We can offer a rich number of opportunities in an everyday learning, creative and challenging atmosphere where Kista, Stockholm, is our base but the world is our arena.
   

  

 We provide the SW platform for radio products also known as the auxiliary control system (XCS). We organize in cross functional development teams, and we are involved in several development activities at the same time. We are in an intense phase, due to 5G/6G development, with many new products in the pipeline. There is a high pressure on quality, flexibility and understanding of HW and SW. It also means working with skilled colleagues in an inspiring environment.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Embeded SW Developer to join our security development team to work on security solution development of auxiliary control system (XCS) for radio. Your role will include system design, SW design, trouble shooting in target environment and product documentation.
   

  

 Team has the end-to-end responsibility for developing cutting edge security solutions for radio products, working on development from early stages of ASIC development up to development security solutions for released radio products. Team is highly peaced and skilled, empowering collaboration, communication and providing ability to learn and grow
   

  

 We are now looking for a Embeded SW Developer to join our security development team to work on security solution development of auxiliary control system (XCS) for radio. Your role will include system design, SW design, trouble shooting in target environment and product documentation.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* You will drive strategic technical leadership
* Develop and test high quality products
* Perform trouble shooting internally
* Develop competence in technical domain
* Execute continuous improvements of products and processes, bring up new SW platforms


**The skills you bring:**
* MSc in engineering or similar
* Min 5 years of relevant experience
* Domain experience: Linux and SW close to HW, systemization and trouble shooting, ASIC knowledge is beneficial
* Experience using FPGA emulators i.e. Palladium, Veloce
* Several years of experience working with C/C++ in an embedded environment, preferably in security domain.
* BootROM development experience
* Product development knowledge and Product Lifecycle Management knowledge
* Ability to work with highly competent colleagues
* Being flexible and responding to change
* Delivering results and meeting customer expectations


**Last date to apply: 15th May 2025**
  
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: React Native App Developer
company_industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos, Technology, Information and Media, and Internet Marketplace Platforms
description:
**WHO WE ARE:** 




  





 Glitnor Group was founded by industry veterans with a wealth of experience in founding and managing numerous successful businesses over the past decade. We have a global presence with a unique and proven track record of building and nurturing strong brands, culture & work environment. Our vision is to take global leadership and change the competitive landscape for Game Studios, Game Operators and Lead Generation.
 



  





 Glitnor has enjoyed rapid growth since its foundation in 2018, and now has over 200 team members representing more than 20 nationalities. The company has physical locations in Sweden, Malta, Bulgaria, Spain and Gibraltar, and also a number of remote team members around the world.
 



  





 We are built on the core belief that work should be a source of positivity. We foster an environment where freedom is coupled with responsibility, empowering individuals to harness their talents and drive professional advancement. We believe in promoting internally where possible, encouraging team members to reach the pinnacle of their ability.
 



  





  





**We are looking for a Native App Developer to join our growing team.** 




  





  





 As a Native App Developer at Glitnor, you will join our talented Native team, which drives the development of our world-class native app offerings. The team is dedicated to creating cutting-edge mobile applications, delivering native optimizations, and enhancing the user experience for our customers. If you’re passionate about mobile app development, especially within the Android ecosystem, and want to contribute to a dynamic, fast-paced environment, this is the role for you.
 



  





  





**What will you be doing?** 




  




* Develop and enhance our native mobile applications, delivering optimizations and features that stand out in the competitive gaming market.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure technical excellence and an outstanding user experience.
* Take ownership of product goals, from planning to implementation and delivery.
* Stay up-to-date with the Android ecosystem and industry best practices to ensure our apps remain cutting-edge.
* Manage the release processes for both iOS and Android, including app signing, provisioning profiles, App Store and Google Play submission, and builds using tools like Fastlane or CI/CD pipelines.



  





  





**What we use** 




  




* Development: React Native, TypeScript
* Testing & Tools: Jest, React Testing Library
* Delivery: Continuous Delivery practices for seamless releases



  





  





**Who are you?** 




  




* 3+ years of experience in mobile app development, with strong expertise in React Native.
* Proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript with a focus on building scalable, high-quality applications.
* Experienced with release processes for both iOS and Android, including app signing, provisioning profiles, and app submissions to the App Store and Google Play.
* Familiar with tools like Fastlane and CI/CD pipelines for managing builds and deployments.
* Passionate about usability and graphical design with a keen eye for detail.
* A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment, taking full ownership of your work.
* A collaborative team player who values teamwork but can also work independently with a strong work ethic.
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal.



  





  





**What will make you stand out?** 




  




* Familiarity with Next.js or other front-end frameworks.
* Experience with page and image optimization techniques.
* Background in iGaming or other similar industries.



  





  





 By joining us, you're not only gaining an opportunity to work and collaborate with the best talent in our industry, you’ll also enjoy a range of fantastic perks!
 


* A competitive and attractive salary
* Private health insurance
* Annual wellbeing benefit allowance
* A weekly breakfast
* Social events for building strong relationships with colleagues



  





  





**At Glitnor we firmly believe that our diversity is what makes us unique and that everyone is welcome to enjoy the ride! We are committed to uphold a high level of diversity and inclusion throughout our group.**

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Senior Platform Engineer
   

  

 We are looking for a Platform Engineer to join our enabling platform team.
   

  

 If you like solving complex technical challenges, improving developer experience, and working in a collaborative environment, you will enjoy being part of this team.
   

  

***What You’ll Do***
 As a Platform Engineer, you will be part of an enabling team that collaborates closely with others. Your focus will be on improving the platform for developers, addressing performance issues, and enhancing reliability. This role involves working across both infrastructure and backend systems, ensuring they run smoothly and support our company’s growth.
   

  

 You will tackle scalability, observability, and automation, helping teams build and run their services efficiently. Additionally, you will contribute to incident management and performance optimizations, ensuring continuous learning and improvement of our systems.
   

  

 You’ll work with AWS, Terraform, Cloudflare, Ruby, and TypeScript, but we don’t expect you to know them all from the start, what matters is your ability to dive in, learn and adapt.
   

  

***Who You Are***
 You have solid experience as a backend engineer with a strong understanding of infrastructure or as a platform engineer with a background in software development. You may have worked with cloud architectures, particularly AWS, and have experience with Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform.
   

  

 You enjoy working collaboratively, helping others solve technical problems, and making sure that teams can build and run their services efficiently. You like problem-solving, learning new things, and finding ways to improve systems at scale.
   

  

 We know that backgrounds and experiences vary, and we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single expectation. If this role sounds exciting and you believe you can contribute, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Product Developer (Parental leave cover, 1 year)
description:
As our Product Developer, you’ll have the opportunity to bring bold and playful products to life -from the first spark of an idea to the final approved sample. You’ll be at the heart of the development process, ensuring that every product meets our creative vision, quality standards and business goals while staying on track with timelines and budgets.
   

  

 This role is more than just execution -it’s about innovation, collaboration and pushing boundaries. You’ll work closely with designers, suppliers and cross-functional teams to continuously improve our products, explore new ideas and challenge the ordinary.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about product development, thrive in a fast-moving and creative environment, and love the unexpected, this is your chance to make an impact. Come join us and add your own spark to a company that believes in color, fun and a little bit of creative weirdness!
   

  

**Main work tasks**
* Responsible for the the execution of new collections from sketch to approved sample, adhering to established routines.
* Participate in the development of new product lines and assess initial pricing for new products or materials.
* Ensure that products, labels and components align with business standards and timelines at the most suitable supplier.
* Maintain accurate product specifications and sample comments for seamless handover to suppliers and production teams.
* Handle internal and external product testing and ensure compliance with quality and composition requirements.
* Introduce innovative ideas to the innovation and sustainability teams, including exploring new materials and qualities.
* Responsible for developments in the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) system as well as to manage article administration in PLM, ensuring master data is accurate and up-to-date.
* Contribute to supplier performance evaluations, providing insights on R&D capabilities, sample precision, service level, and collaboration opportunities.
* Ensuring overall time schedule and deadlines are kept.


**Requirements & Skills**
* Textile education
* Previous experience as Product Developer, preferably 3-5 years
* Experience working with PLM system
* Experience with Microsoft Office
* Availability for travel
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written
* Experience from sock and/or underwear production is an advantage


 Further, you are a creative problem solver with a keen eye for detail and a passion for turning concepts into outstanding products. You thrive in a fast-paced, global environment where you can balance hands-on development, seamlessly moving between ideation, execution and refinement -sometimes all in the same day!
   

  

 Collaboration is at the heart of how you work. You partner closely with cross-functional teams to challenge ideas and refine products to perfection. Rather than sticking to rigid processes, you embrace agility, always looking for smarter, more innovative ways to develop the products.
   

  

 Most importantly, you bring the energy, creativity and curiosity to thrive in a playful and colorful environment. You’re not just developing products -you’re shaping experiences, embracing the unexpected and adding your own spark of creative magic along the way.
   

  

**This is a parental cover for 1 year, from June 2025.** 
 We are recruiting for this role ongoing.
   

  

 Happy Socks aims to spread happiness by turning an everyday essential into a colorful design piece. The business is built on foundations of rigid quality standards, craftsmanship and creativity that are transferred into the products by a talented team of creatives. The products feature endless variations of models and designs, using a broad spectrum of color combinations and original patterns.

title: IFS Software Engineer till Addovation
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett snabbväxande nordiskt IT-tjänstebolag som digitaliserar och förenklar våra kunders affärsprocesser? Har du gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling inom IFS och vill arbeta med spännande kunder och ha en varierande vardag? Då ska du läsa vidare.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som IFS utvecklare/software Engineer blir du en viktig del i vår projektleverans till våra kunder. Du kommer arbeta nära både kund och Addovations projektorganisation med tillhörande konsultteam. Du kommer att arbeta med allt från analys, utveckling och konfiguration till uppgraderingar och integrationer inom IFS Applications/Cloud.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Anpassningar och utveckling i IFS Cloud & IFS Applications
* Integration med tredjepartssystem
* Utveckling av rapporter, skräddarsydda fält, events och automatiseringar
* Datamigreringar och effektivisering av kundens affärsprocesser
* Testa, felsöka, granska och underhålla kod för att säkerställa kvalitet och stabilitet
* Skapa dokumentation, presentations- och utbildningsmaterial
* Arbeta nära kravställare och andra intressenter
* Dela med dig av kunskap, handleda och stötta kollegor


**Om dig:**
 För att lyckas som Software Engineer hos Addovation är din inställning och viljan att lära det viktigaste för oss. Utöver det ser vi gärna att du har en relevant universitets- eller högskolutbildning, helst inom mjukvaruutveckling/informatik. Utöver detta ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete inom IFS, både IFS Cloud & Applications
* Har erfarenhet av IFS-konfigurationer, anpassningar, integrationer och rapportutveckling
* Kunskaper och erfarenhet av SQL och PL/SQL, Custom Events, Quick Reports
* Utveckling i .NET och IFS Cloud webbklienter
* Förmåga att arbeta kundnära och förstå verksamhetsbehov


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi tror att du är en nyfiken och lösningsfokuserad person med stark samarbetsförmåga. Du trivs med att arbeta i team och tar gärna ansvar.
   

  

**Det här är vi!**
 Vi är ett nordiskt IT-bolag som är experter på affärs- och verksamhetslösningar som hjälper bolag att effektivisera sina processer. Utifrån kraftfulla systemplattformar som IFS, Oracle NetSuite och Microsoft 365 kan vi ta ett helhetsgrepp för att underlätta processerna inom våra kunders olika affärskritiska områden.
   

  

 Team Addovation består idag av 200 rådgivare, experter och utvecklare som tillsammans skapar enkla och innovativa lösningar. Vi finns idag i Sverige, Norge, Finland och på Sri Lanka.
   

  

**Varför välja Addovation?**
 Hos oss får du möjligheten att vara en del av ett växande och innovativt företag med en härlig företagskultur som bygger på laganda. Hos oss finns det möjlighet att påverka Addovations framtid och växa med bolaget. Dessutom har vi bra förmåner och stort fokus på kompetensutveckling.
   

  

**Hur du ansöker!**
 Låter detta som en tjänst som passar dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan via vår karriärsida. Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande.
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta vår HR-Generalist therese.matsson@addovation.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: SAP S/4 HANA Developer
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **SAP S/4HANA ABAP Developer** 
 to join our team for a
 **greenfield S/4HANA implementation project** 
 . This role will be critical in designing, developing, testing, and supporting ABAP objects in a clean core, cloud-ready environment. The ideal candidate will collaborate closely with functional consultants and demonstrate deep technical expertise in modern SAP development tools and methodologies.
 



  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 




  




* Design, develop, and support ABAP objects in an S/4HANA environment
* Collaborate with SAP functional consultants to enhance and troubleshoot SAP functionality
* Build strong working relationships with team members and clients to ensure successful delivery of solutions
* Provide technical support during implementation and post-go-live phases



  





**Mandatory Skills:** 




  




* **Good understanding and experience of process changes in new S/4 HANA Implementation along with clean core and cloud ready approach.**
* **Practical implementation exposure on CDS Views and RAP framework**
* Expertise in
 **Key User Extensibility** 
 and
 **On-Stack Developer Extensibility**
* **Good Exposure in RICEF objects, Workflow, Webdynpro, OData, ADT, Eclipse, SP Upgrades and ABAP unit testing framework**
* Understanding of released APIs and best practices for custom
 **Fiori app development using Fiori Elements templates**
* Practical experience with
 **Business Application Studio (BAS)** 
 and
 **Fiori Adaptation Projects**
* Strong understanding of
 **UI principles**
* Experience with
 **Fiori Launchpad configuration**
* Familiarity with
 **Output Parameter Determination (OPD) forms**
* **Good knowledge on any of the SAP Functional area eg; EAM, P2P, FICO, O2C, MM etc.**
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail



  





 Apply now if interested!

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for mobile application development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Mobile iOS Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, make specifications and break down implementation work (epics and stories).
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Take part in end user testing activities.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in iOS app development, mainly with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with git, continuous integration and delivery practices.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.
* Technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar. Bachelor's degree or higher preferred.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere
* Hybrid working model with minimum of 2 office days per week


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Radio SW 5G Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you at the start or about to start your career?
   

  

 We are now expanding our team and looking for new colleagues with a passion and interest in C++ and 5G Radio SW development!
   

  

 We are seeking enthusiastic new C++ developers to join our dynamic software development teams. Upon joining you will become part of a multi-functional team responsible for tasks ranging from initial studies to customer acceptance testing of new radio functionality.
   

  

 Your role will involve designing, developing, and optimizing software solutions, particularly focusing on radio software applications using C++ and Java-based test frameworks within agile development practices.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, develop, and test software solutions.
* Participate in system design, software development, and comprehensive testing of Radio Units.
* Tackle complex technological challenges alongside experienced colleagues.
* Contribute to end-to-end embedded development activities, closely coordinating with both software and hardware teams.
* Engage in software application development primarily using C++, alongside Java-based test framework development.


**The skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Wireless Communication, or a related technical field.
* 2-3 years experience with object-oriented C++ programming.
* Good understanding of Linux-based development environments.
* Familiarity with essential software development tools including version control systems, build systems, and scripting languages.
* Basic knowledge of CI/CD processes.
* Awareness of agile software development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765671

title: Senior Cloud Operations Architect, ES - EMEA
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS), and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? AWS Enterprise Support, Cloud Operations Architect drive our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies - including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 enterprises.
   

  

 As a Sr.Cloud Operations Architect, you will help craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services - including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more. Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support, and risk management.
   

  

 You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 The Sr.Cloud Operations Architect is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
   

  

* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / CDN / Databases / DevOps / Big Data and Analytics / Security / Architecture / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
* External customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with AWS and/or other cloud offerings such as Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Solution Architect, DevOps Engineer, etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools, including: Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef etc.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2975896

title: Business Developer - Swedish Speaking
description:
**Business Developer – Leyton Sverige**
**Om Leyton Sweden:** 
 Leyton Sverige är en del av Leyton Group och etablerades 2021 i Sverige. Vi är specialiserade på att hjälpa innovativa och tillverkande företag att få tillgång till finansiering för att utveckla sina verksamheter och behålla sin konkurrenskraft. Genom våra högkvalitativa finansiella konsulttjänster gör vi en verklig skillnad för både våra kunder och Sveriges ekonomi.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?** 
 På Leyton hjälper vi företag att optimera sina kostnader och öka sina besparingar genom innovativa finansiella lösningar. Våra tjänster är anpassade för att stödja deras tillväxt och utveckling. Med vår unika success fee -modell betalar kunden endast om de faktiskt gör extra besparingar. Vi tar inga förskottsavgifter eller kräver att budgetar ska planeras i förväg – vårt mål är att alla potentiella kunder ska kunna ta del av våra tjänster utan risk.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen som Business Developer?**
 Som Business Developer hos oss har du en nyckelroll i att driva företagets tillväxt. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Ringa och boka möten med C-level-chefer inom en rad olika branscher.
* Delta i möten och kvalificera potentiella kunder.
* Stänga affärer och skapa långvariga kundrelationer.
* Ansvara för att hålla CRM-systemet uppdaterat.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är driven av att nå mål och överträffa förväntningar.
* Trivs med att arbeta i en prestationsbaserad miljö där du har stor påverkan på din egen lön.
* Har en stark vilja att utvecklas och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Gillar utmaningar och att kliva utanför din komfortzon.
* Är nyfiken och vill vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa.


**Varför ska du inte söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du ogillar att arbeta mot uppsatta mål och deadlines.
* Om du inte är intresserad av att utvecklas och ta till dig feedback.
* Om du föredrar en statisk arbetsmiljö och vill hålla dig inom din komfortzon.


**Varför ska du söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du vill sälja en tjänst som verkligen gör skillnad för företag och samhället.
* Om du tror att det är enkelt att sälja tjänster som i praktiken är "gratis" för kunden.
* Om du älskar känslan av att skriva under avtal och stänga affärer.
* Om du vill utveckla dina försäljningsfärdigheter och få direkt påverkan på din lön genom en attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att växa.
* En attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter inom försäljning och affärsutveckling.
* Möjligheten att påverka både företagets och din egen framgång.
* Teamkänsla där du är en del av ett företag som uppskattar och belönar dina prestationer.
* 30 dagars semester, privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och pensionsförmåner.


**Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär? Sluta läsa och kom väx med oss!**

title: Delivery Engineer
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a Delivery Engineer with a focus on building and delivering software for farm milking systems.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a Delivery Engineer, you will be an integral part of the System Engineering team, responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and improving the software build system. You will also support development and test teams in building their pipelines to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Monitor and maintain the software build system in GitLab to ensure its reliability and performance.
* Support development and test teams in building and optimizing their pipelines.
* Manage containerization and orchestration using tools like Docker.
* Write and maintain scripts in Bash, Python, or Groovy to automate tasks and processes.
* Utilize Gradle and Maven for build automation.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of delivery processes and practices.


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* Experience working as a Delivery Engineer.
* Proficiency in at least one scripting language (Bash, Python, Groovy, etc.).
* Hands-on experience with GitLab or GitHub pipelines.
* Strong knowledge of container technologies.
* Familiarity with Gradle and Maven.
* Ability to work effectively in a multi-team environment.


**Your Profile**
* A practical as well as systematical way of working.
* Ability to work independently and cooperate well within the team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to interact with people across functions and cultures.
* An initiative mind.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer**
* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Fedja Mandic, fedja.mandic@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are looking for Senior Business Analysts to join our Global Journey Transformation unit, where we are working to accelerate Ericsson's digital transformation. This is a highly visible role, as this is an executive-level priority in writing the next chapter for Ericsson.
   

  

**As a Senior Business Analyst, you will:**
* Play a critical and high-profile role in driving operational transformation across Ericsson, delivering an extraordinary experience to our end users and customers. You'll be supporting the team to build new products and solutions that strive to transform how Ericsson operates as a company.
* Work with an outstandingly creative team in defining digital strategies, roadmap and execution plans to deliver business value that improves customer experience and operational efficiency.
* Connect with senior business stakeholders and exhibit effective communication skills to translate complex business needs into technical requirements for product and development teams
* Manage the adoption of new digital tools. You will not only get to craft but also implement solutions that will contribute toward positive operational change.
* Develop business cases and build new metrics and OKRs to define the business impact of digital transformation initiatives.
* Manage and drive your own activities. As part of a self-organizing team, you set the tone, build tasks and determine what needs to get done.


**The skills you bring:**
* Selfless team player attitude, always putting the needs of the team first, with willingness to develop others
* Demonstrated ability to take charge of project activities, even with limited knowledge or experience in the subject
* Analytical by nature, feeling comfortable working with ambiguity
* Proven track record of driving digital- and/or business transformation programs in a global context
* 3-5 years of meaningful professional experience, for instance, working as a management consultant, business developer or business analyst. Experience from strategy or operational excellence projects, agile ways of working and from working in the technology industry is advantageous
* Minimum B.Sc., but more advanced degrees (M.Sc. or MBA) are an advantage.


**What happens when you apply?**
* First round – assignment to be completed within a week
* Second round - Recruiter screening to collect information, interests and salary requirements
* Third round – Present assignment and case interview with the team
* Fourth round – Hiring manager interview
* Reference check


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: SAP Functional Lead - Sales and Distribution
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 Our operations and how we support our customers is undergoing a major business transformation – Programme one . A key role in this business and IT transformation journey is our Functional Lead for Sales & Distribution. You will be a key player in one of DeLaval’s biggest business transformation programs ever. As part of this greenfield program, we will replace many of our existing solutions and processes with new solutions from SAP.
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
 You will be our senior solution designer and business advisor, with a deep understanding of business processes and capabilities. Close cooperation with business and IT stakeholders, as well as with SAP and our implementation partner, is your natural way of working. You are a strong advocate and gatekeeper for our principles: standardization, harmonization & simplification.
   

  

**Specific Tasks Include**
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions by applying knowledge of business processes and best practices, ensuring alignment with agreed cost-levels (TCO perspective) and in compliance with development and operations guidelines.
* Keeping guidelines and instructions up to date and addressing deviations from agreed design principles and ways of working.
* Upon completion of our transformation program, continue to be part of the SAP CoE supporting the continuous business development and improvement journey.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a proactive team member who will add value to our program with their SAP, technology, and business competence.
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have about 5 years of experience in a similar senior role, with a strong competence in the S/4 HANA SD-module. Experience of Subscription Billing, GTS and Variant Configuration is advantageous.
* Have been involved in large SAP implementations, preferably greenfield projects.
* Have a strong understanding of SAP software and its capabilities, as well as experience in designing and implementing SAP solutions.
* Are familiar with SAP’s solution landscape as well as best practices, methods and tools from SAP.
* Have a Master of Science university degree (technical faculty or similar) or equivalent through work experience.
* Are fluent in spoken and written English


 We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in business processes and how IT can drive improvements. You bring drive, leadership, and a positive attitude – you’re not afraid to speak up and share your opinions, supported by guiding principles, target architecture, and established ways of working. You are confident in making decisions and actively contribute to decision-making processes. You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, as you will work closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. Work-life balance is important to us and as an employee at DeLaval you have a great benefit package.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This position is preferably based in Tumba (Sweden) with Gallin (Germany) as an alternative. Global travelling will be part of this position. You will report to the Director Enterprise Transformation.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Niklas Falkeling, niklas.falkeling@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com
