title: Tech Lead till offentligt utvecklingsuppdrag inom webb och e-tjänster
description:
Om uppdraget
  
Vi söker en självgående och strukturerad Tech Lead till ett pågående utvecklingsuppdrag inom webbplattform och e-tjänster. Uppdraget omfattar vidareutveckling och förvaltning av en central plattform där både externa och interna användare står i fokus. Det finns ett befintligt utvecklingsteam på plats – din roll blir att ta lead på utvecklingssidan och driva arbetet framåt i nära samarbete med produktägare, arkitekt och projektledning.
  
  

**Uppdraget innebär att:**  

Leda och coacha teamet i tekniska beslut
  
Säkerställa hög kodkvalitet och förvaltningsbarhet
  
Arbeta hands-on med utveckling och arkitektoniska frågor
  
Säkerställa att lösningen ligger i linje med målbild och riktlinjer
  
Samarbeta med andra roller som UX, testledare, kravanalytiker och arkitekter
  
Din profil
  
Du är en erfaren utvecklare med god vana att ta ledande roller i projekt. Du är trygg i din kompetens, men också kommunikativ, lyhörd och van att arbeta tillsammans med både teknik- och verksamhetspersoner.
  
Obligatoriska krav Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET-miljö (.NET, ASP.NET, C#, Web API, MVC)
  
Erfarenhet av Optimizely CMS (version 11–12)
  
Vana att arbeta i agila team och projekt
  
Goda kunskaper i Azure DevOps och Git
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att agera Tech Lead eller motsvarande roll
  
Erfarenhet av Optimizely Search & Navigation
  
Stark kommunikativ förmåga, både muntligt och skriftligt
  
Förmåga att jobba både självständigt och i team
  
Meriterande kompetens KnockoutJS, NPM, Grunt, WebPack
  
Erfarenhet av WCAG och tillgänglighetsanpassning
  
Erfarenhet av SASS och SPA-lösningar
  
Erfarenhet av rek.ai
  
Plats & omfattning
  
  

**Omfattning:** Heltid Plats: På plats i Jönköping – med möjlighet till visst distansarbete Tidsperiod: Start Oktober 2025, initialt 12 månader med option på förlängning
  
Ansökan
  
  

**Vid ansökan ska följande bifogas:**  

CV med relevanta erfarenheter
  
Referensuppdrag som visar liknande erfarenhet, inklusive kontaktuppgifter till referensperson
  
  

Vill du vara med och göra skillnad i en organisation som berör många människors vardag? Ansök nu och bli en nyckelperson i ett viktigt digitalt utvecklingsarbete!

title: UX/UI Designer Trainee
description:
**Kickstart your career in UX/UI design consulting**
 We're looking for soon-to-be graduates who want to make a real business impact through technology. The Columbia Road Associate Program is a one-year, part-time trainee program designed to offer hands-on experience in client work and support professional growth. You'll work side by side with experienced consultants, solving real-life business problems using modern technologies - and having fun while doing it.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Columbia Road was founded in 2016 to challenge the old ways of doing digital business. Our mission is to help companies sell better in the digital era. We focus on measurable results - not just building IT systems - using a mix of software development, design, marketing, strategy, and data engineering.
   

  

 We're a community-led company, built on trust, transparency, and a low hierarchy. Everyone here has a voice in company-wide decisions. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of who we are. We're proud of our 4.6/5 rating on Glassdoor - and always looking to do even better.
   

  

**Requirements**
**What you'll do:**
 As a UX/UI Associate Designer, you'll help shape digital products and services from early ideas to launch and iteration. Your work will include:
   

  

* Understanding user needs and business goals through research and collaboration
* Prioritising use cases and features, mapping user flows, and testing concepts
* Designing wireframes, mockups and prototypes in tools like Figma, Sketch or Adobe XD
* Working closely with developers to bring your designs to life


 We don't expect you to code, but if you do, that's a bonus. Similarly, if you have experience in marketing, that's a great plus - many of our projects sit at the intersection of design, development, and digital marketing, so understanding the broader context adds real value.
   

  

 You'll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team across design, development, marketing and strategy - and engage directly with clients and their users. You'll be given real responsibility from day one, backed by the support of senior designers and consultants.
   

  

**This program is for you if:**
* You're a soon-to-be graduate with some industry experience from projects or part-time work in UI/UX design
* You're curious, motivated, and eager to grow professionally
* You approach problems analytically and want to understand the business impact of your work
* You're comfortable communicating your ideas and working in agile teams
* You approach design as a problem-solving tool, not just a way to make things look good
* You want to create business value through user-centered design
* You're open to experimenting and learning new methods and tools
* You have experience from design, development, or marketing
* You have professional proficiency in both English and Swedish


**Benefits**
* A part-time position along your studies
* A salary based on Sveriges Ingenjörers recommendations
* A community-led organisation with lots of autonomy
* Weekly learning sessions and training opportunities
* Office in central Stockholm, Drottninggatan 33 with daily breakfast & snacks
* Health services incl. mental health, and insurance
* Friskvårdsbidrag in accordance with working hours
* Mobile subscription, tech gear from selection
* Events, hackathons, and fun events organised by Roadies
* Possibility to work on open-source or social impact projects during your free time and get compensated for it


**Recruitment process**
* Deadline to apply: May 15th, 2025
* First round: Phone screen - Get a better picture of the job and help us understand your experience
* Final round: On-site interview - showcase your approach to problem solving and meet some of your potential future colleagues
* Notifications: You'll hear back from us by June 10th at latest


**Timing**
 Start Date: September 15th, 2025. You'll begin with a 2 day on-site onboarding session, after which we'll agree together on when you can start working on projects.
   

  

 The Associate Program is designed as a one-year, part-time opportunity that runs alongside your studies. You'll join us during the academic year, with flexibility to adjust your hours during holidays or exam periods.
   

  

 Please note: we can only consider applicants living within commuting distance of Stockholm. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor work visas for Sweden, so only EU/EEA citizens can apply.
   

  

 Check out our Culture Code and learn more about the program here.

title: Product Designer
description:
**Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.**
**Team spirit, built upon trust & ownership. Together, we decide how to win.**
 We trust each other and take great ownership in what we do. We respect the individual, assume the best in others and believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside the team.
   

  

**New challenges and personal growth.**
 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture.**
 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on- including Health Month, inspirational sessions, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
   

  

**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets!**
 We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
   

  

**🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
**Role**
 As a Product Designer, you’ll play a pivotal role in turning product innovation into intuitive user experiences that address customer pain points while aligning with our business objectives. With the freedom to shape the experience for some of the world’s most renowned brands, you’ll contribute to accelerating their online marketing success. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Drive design direction by ensuring users are at the core of every decision, leveraging user research and data insights to prioritize needs and deliver impactful solutions.
* Deeply understand our business model, ensuring design decisions align with and enhance broader objectives.
* Work closely with tech, product, and other stakeholders to solve complex UX and UI challenges. Support implementation by providing developers with clear, detailed design specifications to ensure a seamless translation of your vision into the final product.
* Share your vision through high-quality concepts and prototypes, knowing when to focus on pixel-perfect details and when low-fidelity sketches are sufficient.
* Feature optimization and establish routines for tracking and refining implemented solutions.
* We welcome you to challenge the status quo, by identifying opportunities to enhance processes and promote efficient ways of working.


**So, what are we looking for?**
* 4+ years of experience as a Product Designer, balancing user needs with business goals and hands-on experience in user research.
* A portfolio showcasing user-centered designs with a strong focus on complex product challenges (ideally, in B2B/SaaS).
* You feel comfortable using your toolbox of design methodologies and are interested in industry trends and best practices that can enhance our products and processes.
* Excellent communication skills, both in presenting ideas and giving/receiving feedback.
* You have a problem-solving and commercial mindset that thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
* It’s a bonus if you have experience within the digital advertising landscape.


**Why join us? 🤔**
 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of passion, collaboration, and challenge. As an Product Designer, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, webinars, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons.
   

  

 We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about bringing great tech products to market and being involved in growing a booming business to levels never before witnessed, send in your application. We want you on the team!

title: Digital Marketing Trainee
description:
**Launch your career in Marketing Technology consulting**
 We're looking for soon-to-be graduates who want to make a real business impact through marketing technology. The Columbia Road Associate Program is a one-year, part-time trainee program designed to offer hands-on experience in client work and support professional growth. You'll work side by side with experienced consultants, solving real-life business problems using modern technologies - and having fun while doing it.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Columbia Road was founded in 2016 to challenge the old ways of doing digital business. Our mission is to help companies sell better in the digital era. We focus on measurable results - not just building IT systems - using a mix of software development, design, marketing, strategy, and data engineering.
   

  

 We're a community-led company, built on trust, transparency, and a low hierarchy. Everyone here has a voice in company-wide decisions. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of who we are. We're proud of our 4.6/5 rating on Glassdoor - and always looking to do even better.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As a Marketing Technology Associate, you'll be at the intersection of marketing and technology, working on projects that improve our clients' customer engagement. Your responsibilities may include:
   

  

* Implementing and optimising marketing automation activities
* Setting up analytics and tagging frameworks
* Enhancing clients' digital marketing campaigns
* Customer Journey, Buyer Persona mapping and Customer Research
* Content Creation


 You'll collaborate closely with developers, designers, fellow marketers, engaging directly with client teams. The work is hands-on and you'll be given real responsibility from day one, with the support of a senior team to guide your growth.
   

  

**Requirements**
**This program is for you if:**
* You're a soon to be graduate student with some industry experience from projects or part-time work in marketing related activities such as Marketing Automation, CRM, Digital Marketing or Analytics
* You're curious, motivated, and eager to grow professionally
* You approach problems analytically and want to understand the business impact of your work
* You're comfortable communicating your ideas and working in agile teams
* You're not afraid to present your thoughts and try out new ways of working
* You enjoy fast-paced environments and want to learn by doing
* You have professional working proficiency in both English and Swedish


**In addition, you might have hands-on experience in some of these technologies:**
* Marketing Automation platforms (e.g. Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Marketo, CustomerIO)
* CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive, MS Dynamics)
* Experience in utilising customer data from various sources (CRM, CDP, DMP)
* Digital advertising understanding (e.g. Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, LinkedIn)
* Web analytics and communicating data insights (e.g. Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Matomo, Piwik PRO)
* SEO, content and technical
* Tag management (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Tealium)
* CRO
* A/B testing
* Service, graphic, and/or UX/UI design
* Copywriting


 We don't expect you to have years and years of experience - lots of positive energy and a "getting things done" attitude are the winning combination.
   

  

 Make sure you showcase your experience and knowledge as clearly as possible in your application, resume and attachments. We value examples and results from previous projects, and we'd love to know what concrete marketing tools you used to get those results.
   

  

**Benefits**
* A part-time position along your studies
* A salary based on Sveriges Ingenjörers recommendations
* A community-led organisation with lots of autonomy
* Weekly learning sessions and training opportunities
* Office in central Stockholm, Drottninggatan 33 with daily breakfast & snacks
* Health services incl. mental health, and insurance
* Friskvårdsbidrag in accordance with working hours
* Mobile subscription, tech gear from selection
* Events, hackathons, and fun events organised by Roadies
* Possibility to work on open-source or social impact projects during your free time and get compensated for it


**Recruitment process**
* Deadline to apply: May 15th, 2025
* First round: Phone screen - Get a better picture of the job and help us understand your experience
* Final round: On-site interview - showcase your approach to problem solving and meet some of your potential future colleagues
* Notifications: You'll hear back from us by June 10th at latest


**Timing**
 Start Date: September 15th, 2025. You'll begin with a 2 day on-site onboarding session, after which we'll agree together on when you can start working on projects.
   

  

 The Associate Program is designed as a one-year, part-time opportunity that runs alongside your studies. You'll join us during the academic year, with flexibility to adjust your hours during holidays or exam periods.
   

  

 Please note: we can only consider applicants living within commuting distance of Stockholm. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor work visas for Sweden, so only EU/EEA citizens can apply.
   

  

 Check out our Culture Code and learn more about the program here.

title: UX Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a UX Architect to focus on the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 We’re shaping the future of user experience across Ericsson’s most complex systems—RAN Architect, from radio networks to cloud-native solutions. As we scale our design impact across technology domains, we’re looking for a UX Architect to help us drive clarity, structure, and strategy in how we build design for scale and complexity.
   

  

 As a UX Architect you will focus on the structural design of user experiences across complex systems and digital products. You will operate at a broader scale—defining how content, navigation, and functionality are organized across the entire product ecosystem.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Architect UX across systems: Organize and structure content in ways that are intuitive and easy to navigate, using sitemaps, taxonomies, and content hierarchies.
* Experience Mapping & Flow Design: Drive the creation of UX frameworks, shared principles, and reusable patterns that improve coherence, reduce duplication, and enable sustainable design growth across product areas.
* Facilitate alignment and strategy: Work with design and non-design stakeholders to bridge user needs with platform capabilities, balancing immediate goals with long-term UX quality and consistency.
* Champion information architecture: Define and evolve models that support intuitive navigation, scalable workflows, and clarity in high-density, enterprise-level UIs.
* Enable collaboration and governance: Support Ericsson Design system integration, General Product Requirements, handoff documentation, and decision rationale to guide implementation and ensure UX intent is preserved.
* Elevate design maturity: Help define what “good” looks like across user experience architecture, bringing in research, systems thinking, and strategic design to support design-led ways of working.


**The skills you bring:**
* A systems thinker with a passion for structuring UX in large-scale, technical environments.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity, building frameworks that bring clarity and enable action.
* You collaborate naturally across disciplines and advocate for user value while understanding technical constraints.
* You have experience with design systems, large information structures, and coordinating across multiple teams or products.
* We’re looking for someone who has…
* 5+ years in UX Architecture, Interaction Design, or UX roles
* Experience designing for enterprise or technical domains
* Strong collaboration skills with product managers, system engineers, developers, and architects, technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools: Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.
* Familiarity with Ericsson technologies or telecom systems is a plus - but curiosity and adaptability matter more.


**How to apply:**
 We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765270

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior user-experience (UX) designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 This position requires a person with experience in understanding our business requirements and any technical limitations and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes. The UX designer will also be encouraged to craft the overall functionality of the product, and to ensure an outstanding user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Share a passion for the value of UX and Human-centered design across various user interfaces by working with an interdisciplinary team.
* To achieve higher quality, lower costs, and shorter time to release, keep up to date with UX processes, tools and standard methodologies.
* Engage in all phases of product development and implementation with system engineers, business stakeholders, and product managers.
* Produce materials that help the team understand the recommendations, storyboards, wireframes, journey maps, concept, and prototype designs, etc.
* Design and refine interactions based on the best prototyping options and user testing, including synthesis and incorporation of feedback.
* Use the accurate component from the Ericsson design system library for appropriate features and consistent user experience.
* Work with developers to understand the opportunities and limitations of the technology that will be used to express the design solution, document requirements, and explain the expectations around an interaction.
* Support your teammates' growth by participating in UX meetings and collaborative design reviews


**The skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree in an UX-related field of study or equivalent experience.
* Working experience in UX design (information architecture, interaction design and visual design).
* Flexibility in working both independently and collaboratively
* The ability to independently research and resolve issues using appropriate resources.
* Strong visual design skills and a keen sense of effective UI.
* Skilled in technical documentation, generating reports, design assessments, and leading scoping and review sessions. Experienced in following and contributing to technical processes.
* Extensive experience crafting user flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, user interface designs and high-quality final visual comps.
* Experience conducting usability tests.
* Having delivered designs to engineering teams and proven track record of presenting to and influencing stakeholders and senior management.
* Excellent experience in coordinating development, status, and delivery of projects using project management skills and tools.
* Experience in B2B environments is considered a strong advantage.


**How to apply:**
 We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.

title: Graphic Artist
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey, growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone leads and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference
   

  

 As a
 **Graphic Artist** 
 , you will play a vital role in expanding and refining our library of Picture Communication Symbols (PCS) while designing and creating technical illustrations, iconography, and layouts that support our hardware and software products. You will collaborate across teams to produce high-quality, accessible design solutions that empower individuals with disabilities to communicate and engage with the world.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design and create new Picture Communication Symbols for communication and curricular software.
* Develop and design documents to support hardware and software products.
* Create engaging illustrations for curricular software and print activities.
* Collaborate with content developers and technical writers to ensure artwork meets product requirements.
* Track, document, and manage design projects to meet deadlines.
* Support occasional social media promotions with creative designs.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* An Associate's Degree in Graphic Design or equivalent work experience.
* 2+ years of experience working as a graphic artist.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) on both MAC and PC platforms.
* Experience with print design is a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, and internet applications.
* Strong project management and organizational skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for collaboration across teams.
* A strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Design Director (Design Foundation)
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As a Product Design Director for our Design Foundation area, you will shape and lead all aspects of Mentimeter’s enabling design functions, including our design system, accessibility practice, content design, localization and design operations. You will partner closely with design, product and engineering peers across the organization to ensure teams and individuals have the guidance, frameworks, and support needed to create cohesive and high-quality user experiences.
   

  

 You will rely on a mix of qualitative and quantitative insights to inform decisions about the evolution and implementation of our design foundation. Together with the Design Leadership Team, you will set a clear vision, define an operating model for these enabling functions, and ensure that they effectively support both our core and commercial product areas.
   

  

 In this role, you will also be responsible for the career development of diverse design specialists, such as design system designers, accessibility experts, and content designers. You will manage, coach and mentor them to create meaningful impact and grow in their careers, ensuring that Mentimeter’s design foundation continues to advance our overall product experience.
   

  

 Areas of responsibility
   

  

 This is an existing position that is currently held by an interim consultant, and we are looking for someone who can join as a full time employee.
   

  

 Strategic Leadership
   

  

* Define, communicate, and execute a compelling vision for the Design Foundation area at Mentimeter.
* Establish strategies, goals, and metrics for the enabling functions (design system, accessibility, and content design) that elevate the quality and consistency of our product experiences.
* Collaborate with cross-functional leaders in Product, Engineering, and beyond to integrate foundational design practices and standards throughout the organization.
* Ensure the direction for our design foundation is clearly articulated, forward-thinking, and consistently applied, helping all teams deliver seamless user experiences.
* Drive and evolve design operations initiatives—such as career frameworks and ways of working—together with the Design Leadership Team.


 People Leadership
   

  

* Lead, inspire, and coach a multidisciplinary area of specialists within the design craft as a design leader and manager
* Oversee career growth and development frameworks, providing individualized mentorship and guidance.
* Foster a collaborative environment where each team member is empowered to innovate, take ownership, and continuously refine their craft.
* Partner with the broader design organization to ensure consistency, share learnings, and maintain a strong, supportive design culture.


 Craft Leadership
   

  

* Serve as an active member of the Design Leadership Team, championing best practices for design, ux writing, accessibility, and brand across Mentimeter’s products.
* Lead cross-area design initiatives in partnership with other leaders to continuously refine and improve our design standards and processes.
* Develop and maintain a cohesive design language, ensuring it evolves in response to user needs, technological advances, and the strategic direction of the company.
* Continuously gather insights and evaluate the impact of the central using qualitative and quantitative methods.


 So, who are you?
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in design leadership roles, with demonstrated success managing and mentoring diverse design teams (e.g., design systems, accessibility, or content).
* Proven track record of driving impactful design operations initiatives and establishing processes that scale in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong leadership abilities, with the capacity to navigate complex challenges and inspire high performance across multiple functions.
* Expertise in leading and evolving design systems and design standards, ensuring consistency and quality across a broad product portfolio.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate decisions and advocate for user-focused design within cross-functional teams.
* A passion for building cohesive, accessible, and user-centric experiences that empower and delight customers.


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Digital Experience & Content Lead
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Digital Experience & Content Lead for our Brand & Marketing team based in Stockholm!**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow.
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re looking for a creative, content-driven professional with a technical edge to take full ownership of Truesec’s website and lead our digital content experience. This isn’t just about keeping pages updated — it’s about crafting a cohesive, engaging, and high-performing web presence that reflects our brand and drives real impact.
   

  

 You’ll plan, write, and optimize content that attracts, informs, and converts — all while working closely with colleagues across marketing, product, and design. In this role, no two days are the same: you’ll need to be adaptable, collaborative, and ready to shift focus as needs evolve. From SEO and analytics to AI-driven improvements, you'll be the go-to person for everything content-related on our website.
   

  

 As a Digital Experience & Content Lead you'll:
   

  

* Own the website content end-to-end – from structure and strategy to creation, updates, and continuous optimization
* Ensure messaging is always aligned, accurate, and reflects our brand, services, and business goals
* Drive a steady flow of content updates, including blog posts, articles, and thought leadership pieces in collaboration with experts across the organization – ensuring content is optimized for SEO and performance
* Create new content as needed: landing pages, service descriptions, case studies, career pages, and more
* Collaborate closely with internal teams to align messaging, enhance storytelling, and support business goals
* Leverage SEO, analytics, and user data to improve visibility, engagement, and conversion
* Experiment with AI tools to streamline content creation and support scalable content delivery
* Stay flexible and responsive – priorities may shift, and you’ll be expected to adjust quickly while maintaining high quality


**Your Potential Background**
* 3+ years in digital content, web management, or UX writing (ideally in B2B or tech)
* Excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to simplify complex topics
* Strong understanding of SEO, Google rankings, and how to optimize content for performance
* Comfortable working with CMS tools (e.g., WordPress) and basic web tech (HTML/CSS is a plus)
* A curious mindset and interest in AI and emerging content technologies
* A collaborative, team-oriented approach — you enjoy working with others and building strong relationships
* Adaptability and a proactive mindset — you thrive in dynamic environments and take initiative when priorities change
* High sense of ownership, attention to detail, and a drive to continuously improve the digital experience


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Senior Service Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We at the Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior Service Designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 We’re seeking a strategic individual with experience working in multidisciplinary teams, applying human-centered design principles. By deepening our understanding of how customers interact with our systems and services, we aim to continuously improve our software solutions and service experiences.
   

  

 Your area of expertise may be in a specific field, but your strength is thinking strategically, solving problems creatively, and working collaboratively. The role entails conducting research and projects inside R&D to understand user needs, build compelling design experiences, and assist organizations with implementation.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Lead and drive user-centered design initiatives across complex, technical telecom software domains—collaborating closely with product managers, system engineers, and developers to ensure the UX perspective is integrated throughout.
* Facilitate and participate in design thinking workshops, co-creation sessions, and stakeholder dialogues to align on goals and unlock opportunities across teams and time zones.
* Conduct and analyze research through interviews, desk research, and global user engagement to uncover actionable insights and support iterative prototyping.
* Translate complex technical documentation and abstract ideas into user-friendly, clear, and actionable design concepts.
* Create thoughtful, human-centric experiences across service touchpoints by working in cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams.
* Use storytelling and visual communication to share insights, journey maps, and concept proposals with technical and non-technical audiences alike.
* Develop design content, artifacts, and specifications in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and other tools—supporting both local projects and broader business area collaborations.
* Balance multiple ongoing studies and projects, bringing structure, clarity, and a user-focused mindset to everything from workshop facilitation to final delivery.


**The skills you bring:**
* Human-centered design/service design experience
* Degree in Interaction Design, Service Design, Human-Computer Interaction, UX Design, or related field.
* Working experience in a design consultancy or equivalent position.
* Ability to work independently on key workstreams in large projects or take ownership of small ones
* Organizational skills and ability to lead multiple projects.
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Professional in current software design practices.


**How to apply:**
 We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process.  Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
