title: Account Manager Research Business (m|f|d) for Northern Sweden and Finland, Stockholm-based
description:
**Company Description**
**Scientist Gone Social? We’ve Got the Perfect Job for You**
 (For the bench scientist who secretly always wanted to be out meeting people.)
   

  

 For 35 years, Miltenyi Biotec has been on a mission to advance science and improve lives. We're a global crew of 4,700 scientists, engineers, marketers, and all-round problem-solvers creating innovative products for basic research, translational studies, and cellular therapy.
   

  

**Miltenyi Biotec Nordics** 
 is a team of more than 20 dedicated colleagues based out of Lund, Sweden - your future partners in crime (the legal kind, obviously). When you're not out visiting customers, drop by the office for idea swaps, coffee, or just a good old-fashioned fika.
   

  

 We’re growing fast, thinking big, and ready to welcome you.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Do you prefer customer visits over desk duty? Great—so do we.**
 We’re on the lookout for a Account Manager Research Business covering North of Sweden and Finland who’s more “let’s go” than “let’s email.” Someone who loves science but prefers people over pipettes. If you're passionate about science, naturally curious, and thrive when you're out meeting people and building relationships, rather than staring at spreadsheets, then we think you'll love this role. Especially if you're looking to make a real impact in a team that listens to your ideas and gives you the freedom to shape your own day.
   

  

**If you're nodding along, keep reading.**
 This is a brand-new position, which means you get to shape it and make it your own. We have ideas, but we’re more excited about yours.
   

  

**The mission:**
* Drive sales activities across your territory.
* Connect with researchers and clinicians working in cell therapy and immunology.
* Be the go-to person for Miltenyi’s innovative instruments and reagents.
* You’ll spend a significant part of your time visiting customers—building strong relationships, understanding their needs, and supporting them with tailored solutions that help them do better science, faster.
* Travel with over-night stays around 30 days per year. Being on the road in the Stockholm area for the main time of your week.


 Collaborate with a team of experts who are passionate about sharing their knowledge - and always ready to lend a hand (or a laugh).
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Here’s what we imagine you’re like:**
* A solid scientific background, ideally in immunology, cell biology, or a related field is a must. You’ll be having in-depth conversations with researchers, so being able to navigate complex scientific topics with confidence is key to earning their trust and offering real value.
* Self-starting and results-driven. You like to try new things and find smart ways to bring value to your customers. You’d rather lead the way than wait for instructions.
* You love science - but those solo days at the bench? A bit too quiet for you - you are more excited about customer meetings than calendar invites.
* You believe trust and relationships close more deals than slide decks. You bring honesty, integrity, and the stamina to build lasting relationships and follow through, even when the going gets tough.
* Happy to collaborate, but confident working independently. You are empathetic and curious.
* Oh, and you’re probably pretty good at Scrabble, in English, Finish, or Swedish. Maybe even all three.


**Additional Information**
 You´re based in the greater
 **Stockholm area** 
 , with a good network in the science community.
   

  

 What’s in it for you (besides awesome colleagues and a job you’ll actually enjoy)?
   

  

* A company car, because you’ll be out and about, not just Zooming from your kitchen.
* Pension benefit that kicks in from day one (yes, day one).
* A competitive salary that makes your effort worth it.
* An attractive bonus scheme that isn’t just “theoretical”, it’s achievable and yes, we want you to earn it.
* When you're not on the road, your home office is your HQ. Coffee just the way you like it, and no mysterious leftovers in the fridge.


**If this sounds like your kind of adventure, hit apply. Let’s bring science to life - together.**
**Contact us**
 If you have the skills and qualifications for this position, please use the link to send us your details (application letter, curriculum vitae, references and certificates). Please give us an idea of when you can start and the kind of salary you are looking for, outlining why you have applied.

title: SERVICE MANAGER NETWORK
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Data Services
description:
*Bankgirot söker en Service Manager Network till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.* 




*Bankgirot har en unik position på Sveriges betalmarknad, som just nu genomgår sin största transformation i modern tid.* 




  





*Vår IT-organisation växer för att utveckla framtidssäkra lösningar som uppfyller internationella standarder och regelverk. Samtidigt säkerställer vi att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar stabilt och säkert – varje dag.* 




  





*Utvecklingen av framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi söker dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Service Manager Network får du en nyckelroll i att säkra framtidens betalningslösningar på ett teknikbolag där vi brinner för vårt uppdrag – och för varandra.* 




  





**Din roll** 




 Du blir en central del av Bankgirots omfattande transformationsresa och får en nyckelroll i att bygga vår helt nya "Greenfield"-lösning för en framtidssäker betalningsinfrastruktur. Det här är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill vara med från grunden och skapa en modern plattform som formar Sveriges betalflöden.
 



  





 Som Service Manager Network inom nätverksområdet kommer du att arbeta inom Infrastructure Services i vår driftsorganisation och ha fullt ansvar för att forma, utveckla och leda leveransen av våra nätverkstjänster. Du kommer vara en nyckelperson i vår resa mot en tjänstebaserad och modern IT-leveransmodell.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:** 



* Säkerställa kontinuerlig utveckling och förbättring av tjänsteleveranserna i linje med verksamhetens strategi och myndighetskrav
* Livscykelhantering av tjänsterna och att säkerställa att säkerhetskraven efterlevs
* Fatta tekniska beslut kopplade till tjänsteområdet, inklusive val av plattform, verktyg och arbetsmetoder
* Tätt samarbete med Tech Lead
* Ansvara för budget, prognos och kostnadsuppföljning inom tjänsteområdet
* Kravställa och följa upp leverantörers SLA/KPI:er samt tekniska lösningar
* Rapportera internt om tjänsternas status och utveckling
* Leda riskhantering och hantera eskaleringar
* Facilitera samverkan internt och externt, både med leverantörer och verksamheten
* Kommunicera tydligt om tjänsternas status, förändringar och utvecklingsplaner



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Vi tror att du har en gedigen bakgrund inom tjänstebaserad IT-leverans, gärna i miljöer med en hybrid leveransmodell. Du har god teknisk förståelse för nätverksområdet och gärna erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetstjänster.
 



 Du har tidigare arbetat enligt ITIL-baserade processer och har erfarenhet av både budgetarbete och prognostisering. Har du dessutom arbetat inom den finansiella sektorn och är bekant med de styrande regelverk som gäller där, är det meriterande.
 



 Vi ser att du har en relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande kompetens genom tidigare erfarenheter. Din kommunikativa förmåga är mycket god, och du samarbetar väl med både interna och externa intressenter. Du arbetar strukturerat, har en stark drivkraft och är van att leda och följa upp komplexa leveranser i en tekniskt avancerad miljö.
 



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



 Intresserad?
 



 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Amanda Eksell: amanda.eksell@nexergroup.com eller +46 707 434 173
 



  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Business Development & Engineering Manager
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 We are looking to recruit a Business Development and Engineering (BDE) Manager to fill a key role in our Upplands Väsby (UV) plant.
   

  

 If you are a driven leader with multi-level stakeholder influencing skills, this position will give you unique exposure to both Manufacturing and Category growth, taking your career to the next level.
   

  

 The BDE Manager is a senior strategic role based in our UV plant. As a key member of the Plant Leadership Team, you will be directly responsible for the delivery of the BDE agenda for the plant, managing, coordinating, and overseeing I2M and IIM processes ensuring effective planning and execution of change as it relates to new and existing products, packaging and processes.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Lead and champion Site Engineering best practices utilizing IL6S and I2M/IM methodologies.
* Lead the roll out of the IIM pillar in support of the overall implantation of IL6S
* Define and agree Capital Investment plans, and lead capital spend and phasing across the cluster.
* Provide mid/long term capacity planning at plant level to enable overall network capacity planning.
* Execute capital projects. Right First Time, with Vertical Start Ups to the highest standard of Safety and Quality.
* Support Site Strategic Plan / Annual Contract creation: Support the Plant Leadership team in developing the site strategy and plant road map.
* Lead, coach and develop the talent of the local BDE organisation.
* Provide effective conversion change coordination including project costing, timing and capital requirements, applying engineering best practices, most efficient use of plant capability and capacity while maintaining high-level customer service.
* Ownership for setting and delivering the UV site roadmap for recipe, plant layout and infrastructure, engaging and influencing key stakeholders as required. You will also develop Global and Regional links to benchmark and drive improvement for key manufacturing technologies.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
   

  

* Strong operational & manufacturing experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, LEAN, 6 sigma tools and concepts, Safety & GMP standard.
* Good understanding of end-to-end processes in the manufacturing and business environment; working knowledge of commercialization process (I2M); project leadership / management skills and technical and financial aspects of the business.
* Strategic thinking, while having ability to excel in leading tactical programs.
* Highly action oriented, drive for results, innovative, challenging actual set-ups, entrepreneurial ability.
* Excellent communication (verbal & written), coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment.
* Demonstrated abilities in analytics, problem solving and team building.
* Possess excellent interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization.


**Education and Experience:**
* University education in Engineering.
* Fundamental know-how and experience in food processes and products required.
* Good knowledge of technical and financial affairs required.
* Experience within production and working experience managing teams/projects.
* Extensive experience within Engineering
* Strong people management skills required.
* Strong communication and negotiation skills to manage cross-functional interfaces required.
* Analytical and conceptual skills required.
* Strong project management and organisational skills required.
* New product launch, commercialisation, and I2M process skills.
* Idea Leadership, Business Acumen preferred.


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Project Engineering
   

  

 Science & Engineering

title: Head of Operational Excellence
company_industry: Mining, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
As Head of Operational Excellence, you will play a key role in designing, implementing and developing our IT operating model. This includes driving best practices, optimizing processes, enhancing service delivery and ensuring alignment with business goals. You will report directly to Group CIO and work closely with IT leadership, cross-functional teams and key business stakeholders to foster a culture of excellence, accountability and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop and lead the IT Operational Excellence strategy and roadmap.
* Define and track KPI’s and benchmarks to measure operational effectiveness and drive accountability.
* Drive the design and implementation of IT processes aligned with organizational priorities.
* Work together with other operational excellence specialists to drive adoption of the IT Operating Model, common principles and good practices used in everyday work.
* Support risk management, compliance and audit activities.
* Work closely with leaders to identify opportunities for process enhancements.
* Provide training and guidance to teams on new processes.
* Facilitate change management in leading and supporting operational initiatives.
* Coach and facilitate teams and individuals to identify and implement improvement opportunities


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience in IT operations, IT service management or process improvement roles.
* Strong knowledge of ITIL, Lean or similar frameworks
* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Strong analytical, problem-solving and leadership skills
* Ability to lead a variety of cross-functional team members
* Excellent organizational and follow-up skills
* Experience in project management
* English language both written and verbal. Swedish and Finish are a merit.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Boliden IT, you will be part of a forward-thinking team that is at the forefront of digital innovation in the mining and metals industry. You will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our digital transformation journey and contribute to a more sustainable future.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on this challenge and become our new Head of Operation Excellence? Apply now and be part of our exciting journey!
   

  

 This role is located in the Boliden office or Stockholm office.
   

  

**Apply before the 30th of May 2025 to be part of something truly meaningful!** 
 Selection will be ongoing, so we are looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Do you want to know more about the position? Please contact the recruiting manager Mathias Nilsson, CIO via mail: mathias.nilsson@boliden.com
   

  

 Questions regarding your application are answered by Talent Acquisition Partner Jessica Grönwall via mail: jessica.gronwall@ext.boliden.com
   

  

 Trade union information is available from Giovanni Cibrario, SACO, 070- 225 67 53, Andreas Mårtensson, Unionen, 070-541 83 93 or Peter Markström, Ledarna, 0910-77 40 09.
   

  

 If you are a representative of a recruiting firm, please refrain from contacting us about this posting. We appreciate your consideration.
   

  

 Important! If you are a current employee within Boliden you shouldn't complete the application at this site, please log on to your Workday account and apply through "Find Jobs".

title: Infor M3 Business Analyst
description:
Har du några års erfarenhet av Infor M3 och är specialist i en eller flera moduler av systemet? Vill du utvecklas ytterligare och få vara med på en spännande ERP-transformation? Vill du bidra med din kunskap i en storskalig M3 Cloud-utrullning och vara en del av ett samarbetsinriktat team?
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Nu söker Dreamwork för kunds räkning flera personer som kommer arbeta som M3 Business Analyst. Det är en intern roll hos ett svenskt bolag som finns på flera platser i Sverige och i utlandet. Placeringsort kan vara Göteborg, Stockholm eller Växjö.
   

  

 Oavsett om du har djup expertis eller är i början av din M3 Cloud-resa, kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att säkerställa att vår M3 Cloud-lösning är optimerad, sömlöst integrerad och anpassad till våra operativa behov.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av en eller flera moduler i Infor M3. Vi använder oss främst av affärsprocesserna i Order to Cach, Supply Chain/ WMS, Procurement & Product Quality / Procure to pay och Financial Management. Har du erfarenhet av IFS eller SAP ser vi det som likvärdigt med M3.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden
   

  

* Stödja implementeringen och utrullningen av Infor M3 Cloud inom hela organisationen, både i Sverige och utlandet. Resor kan förekomma inom Europa.
* Hjälpa till att konfigurera M3 Cloud för att matcha verksamhetens krav
* Säkerställa smidig integration mellan M3 Cloud och andra affärskritiska system
* Samarbeta med interna team och leverantörer för att säkerställa systemkompatibilitet
* Felsöka och lösa problem relaterade till M3 Cloud och systemintegrationer
* Ge utbildning och support till slutanvändare


 Vad vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Infor M3 Cloud, antingen vid implementationsprojekt eller i daglig drift
* God kunskap om Infor M3 och relaterade program som stöder affärsplaneringsprocesser
* God förståelse för M3s affärsprocesser; Order to Cach, Supply Chain/ WMS, Procurement & Product Quality / Procure to pay och Financial Management
* Intresse eller erfarenhet av systemintegrationer mellan M3 Cloud och externa applikationer
* Förmåga att samarbeta med olika team och översätta affärsbehov till systemlösningar
* Erfarenhet av affärsanalys och kravprocesser
* Problemlösningsförmåga och en vilja att lära dig mer
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska


 Varför ska du välja oss?
   

  

* Du blir en del av ett välmående bolag som verkar internationellt och utvecklar varumärken inom olika produktkategorier. Bolaget riktar sig till både företag och konsumenter, med fokus på bred marknadstäckning och hållbar tillväxt. Med verksamhet i flera länder och ett väletablerat nätverk arbetar företaget kontinuerligt med att utveckla sitt erbjudande och stärka sin position på marknaden.
* Du får vara med om en omfattande M3 Cloud-utrullning
* Du får arbeta i ett dynamiskt och stöttande team där lärande och samarbete står i fokus
* Du erbjuds mycket goda möjligheter till karriärutveckling i en spännande och innovativ miljö


 Ansökan
   

  

 Denna rekrytering hanteras av Dreamwork för kunds räkning. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid i Göteborg, Stockholm eller Växjö. Hybridarbetsplats tillämpas. Tillträde till tjänsten är enligt överenskommelse. Du söker tjänsten på www.dreamwork.se eller www.poolia.se Vänligen bifoga CV och personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kommer att kalla till intervjuer löpande så sök gärna tjänsten så snart som möjligt. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christina Martinsson, ansvarig rekryterare på Dreamwork, 0735-180904 eller christina.martinsson@dreamwork.se

title: Strategic Sourcing Manager, Software & IT- Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Tietoevry Tech Services is thrilled to embark on an exciting journey under new ownership. This change opens new possibilities and growth opportunities for our company and our employees. We are looking for talented people who want to join us on this exciting journey and help shape the digital landscape in the Nordics.
   

  

 At Tietoevry Tech Services, we specialize in driving enterprise-wide digital transformation. Our expertise lies in helping Nordic societies and businesses by modernizing and developing processes, applications, and infrastructure, providing reliable, secure, and efficient IT services. Under new ownership, we'll continue our journey to shape the future of technology in the Nordics together with our customers.
   

  

 Now you have an extraordinary chance to join our Sourcing Team in the most exciting journey of building an independent and standalone company. As we are currently demerging from Tietoevry, you will play an incremental role in building up a stand-alone Sourcing function.
   

  

 You will join a skilled, diverse team of over 20 sourcing and purchasing professionals, collaborating to drive innovation, excellence and continuous learning. You will be responsible to drive Software and technology related sourcing initiatives for Tietoevry Tech Services, by having a structured, highly collaborative & impact driven working approach.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Actively seeking new opportunities for sourcing initiative pipeline and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, focus on software licensing agreements
* Taking the lead in planning and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, cultivating strong collaboration with Stakeholders
* Sourcing business partner for designated business stakeholders
* Developing category plans to capture short- and long-term business opportunities with financial impact and plan the execution of sourcing initiatives
* Proactively lead, plan and drive negotiations, particularly for larger, complex sourcing initiatives
* Managing and securing up-to-date information for supplier contracts
* Supplier management for designated suppliers. Drive and develop strategic supplier relationship in collaboration with stakeholders
* Provide direction to buyers on suppliers and contracts, ensuring compliance, quality, and efficiency in the purchase-to-pay process.
* Constantly seeking for opportunities to simplify and work in more efficient way
* Contributing to overall team performance as active member of the sourcing team


**Personality & working style:**
 You are an engaging and business-minded sourcing professional with extensive experience of strategic sourcing within technology and a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives and supplier management to ensure execution of the negotiated deals:
   

  

* Doer who has bias for action & delivering impact – highly structured way-of-working, impact-oriented approach and independent (self-starter) working style
* Influencing and presenting skills – you have ability to communicate effectively both with executives and specialists and genuine desire & ability to deliver business impact to the company
* Highly analytical & fact-based – you can both see the big picture, identify long term trends and to drill down to drivers when needed. You use data to drive real business benefits and bring speed to decision making and execution
* Result oriented project manager - Being able to identify new opportunities to create impact, prioritize the work and secure successful implementation of these initiatives
* Highly skilled in negotiation, indirect influencing and selling ideas in complex matrix organizations.
* Team player who can contribute to teamwork, also in areas outside of own direct responsibilities
* Can-do attitude, strong interpersonal skills and collaborative approach


**Experience & education:**
* 5+ years of strategic sourcing experience with a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives within technology and managing global suppliers
* Experience in working with global software suppliers is preferred
* Experience in software licensing from infrastructure, security and compliance, and cloud based -solutions business models is preferred
* Proven negotiation skills
* Experience in building and managing strategic supplier relationship
* Experience of managing spend and using TCO (total cost of ownership)
* Experience from working in international organization with complex business models and matrix organization
* M.Sc. from relevant field
* Fully proficient written and verbal English communication skills


**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Monica Derksen, monica.derksen@tietoevry.com
   

  

  

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Riga, Espoo or Solna
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Early Career Program Business Controller
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you part of the next generation finance managers at Ericsson?
   

  

 Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to becoming and developing as a leader. You will engage with commercial projects at a strategic and global level, rising up to challenges, and work in a truly international company. As part of the Excellerate program you are able to seize the initiative, operate with a consultative approach and drive change.
   

  

 The program will ensure you gain real practical insight into our business, our stakeholders and our customers across the globe, and how we integrate end-to-end solutions to ensure everyone worldwide is connected. Your journey within the Excellerate Program will start as a Business Controller in Segment Cloud Software and Services (CSS). CSS provides industry leading solutions for Core Network and Automation, Managed Services, Services Orchestration, BSS, and Cognitive AI Software. We help enable operators to succeed as they prepare their networks for the future.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 You will be joining the central finance team in CSS where you’ll help drive the Segment’s strategic finance agenda. During your secondment with the Segment finance team you will spend your time with day-to-day responsibilities as well as cross unit strategic tasks and help analyse complex financial and non-financial data to turn numbers into actionable insights. You will be part of a diverse team of experienced colleagues.
   

  

**The skills you bring:**
 Joining the team will offer you an exciting journey through business and technology where you will learn, be able to challenge, take decisions and most importantly have a lot of fun! We believe that you have a curious and positive mindset and a challenging attitude. A genuine interest for business and financial management is very important together with an interest in the communications industry.
   

  

 In addition, we believe you have:
   

  

* BSc or MSc in Business Finance or similar
* 2-4 years of relevant work experience in e.g. strategy, accounting, business control
* Passion about bringing your ideas to the table
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally, with a desire and ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Keen interest to learn new things and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Solid presentation and communication skills, and proficiency in English


 We can promise you a steep learning curve, exciting tasks and close collaboration as a valued member of a strategically important team. Be the one who did. Find out more about our Early Career program, what the alumni's are up to now and how the program can transform your career at www.ericsson.com/ecp
   

  

 The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English. If you have specific questions you are welcome to email recruiter Srishti Tandon srishti.tandon@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**

title: Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager** 
 to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
* Manage the Data & Analytics team.
* Enable data driven operating model, unveil insights & opportunities through continuous data analysis.
* Give management team clear summaries (automated) of how business is performing from interest through to value of cars in market, value of customers, LTV - people view and car view.
* Responsible for providing business analytics & reporting to RBU management.
* Provide leadership and direction for the data governance framework: principles, policies, processes, and practices.
* Leads design, implementation, and oversight of data quality measures to ensure data health across the RBU.
* Monitor data usage, share best practice trends in data use, and provide insight into how and where teams can use data to help in day-to-day decision-making.
* Ensure compliance and security of the data (e.g., Data privacy (GDPR)).
* Set up any data audit and define actions/roadmap; Set up any data cleansing strategy and tools.
* Responsible for defining the data and identifying assets within RBU data domains, ensuring there isn't conflict with other data elements.
* Ensure that data is accurate and up-to-date (e.g., Customer data).
* Map and understand database and data collection processes for the RBU.
* Create processes and procedures along with access controls to monitor adherence, establishing internal policies and standards-and enforcing those policies.
* Maintain quality of the data using customer feedback, concerns, questions; internally reporting metrics; evaluating and identifying issues; and coordinating and implementing corrections regularly.
* Lead development and implementation of Master data Management (MDM) rules.
* Manage special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national Management.
* Collaborate with the IS/IT team to Ensure appropriate governance & compliance while contributing to IS/IT roadmap.


**What we look for:**
* Minimum 10 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus.
* Experience in cross-cultural and remote Management. HQ Experience is a plus.
* Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous.
* Experience in data Management/engineering.
* Master degree in quantitative or business related field is required.
* Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
* Analytical skills.
* Advanced PC skills, Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel, Presentation skills, Knowledge of information technologies, standards, and best practices prevalent in data governance, data quality, and data privacy.
* Experience with BI tools (Tableau, QlikView etc.).
* Data-driven decision-making.
* Ability to simplify.
* Demonstrated knowledge of data as a strategic asset to support business strategy and deliver measurable value.
* Excellent analytical capabilities with the Ability to develop KPIs and measure progress on data governance and data maturity model.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills (English language) with ability to engage and influence by adapting communications across the organization.
* Project skills and work cross-functional.
* Process-oriented - experience creating and documenting policies and procedure.
* Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs.
* Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions.


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: H&M HOME KEY CITY STORE MANAGER – STOCKHOLM
description:
**Company Description**
**Do you want to be a key player in building a world-class interior brand? Are you passionate about customer service and ready for an exciting challenge in one of the H&M HOME Concept Stores? Then you might be the one we are looking for!**
**At H&M Home, our purpose is to make it possible for many people to create a personal and modern space — a place to feel at home.**
**Our vision is to be a credible world-class interior brand, and here YOU have a very important role as a leader. We will reach our vision by being brave, daring to test ideas, learning from experiences and getting new insights.**
**In everything you do, our customers should always be top of mind. You have the vital role to create an outstanding and inspiring shopping experience for our customers every day.**
**Job Description**
**The role as Store Manager (SM)**
 As Store Manager at H&M Home you have the important role to create an excellent and inspiring shopping experience for our customers every day. The role as Store Manager is to lead and develop your team to achieve budgeted and planned sales and profitability targets, through providing excellent customer service and ensuring optimal and efficient store operations. As Store Manager, your responsibilities are divided into five parts: Customers, Colleagues, Procedures, Planning and Results & Profitability. You are an ambassador for the brand and together with the team you strive to exceed customer expectations and drive selling on the sales floor, that’s where it all happens!
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 The job of a SM comes with lots of responsibility – and lots of fun.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Provide excellent customer service in your store and coach your team to always keep our customer top of mind.
* Follow up on sales KPIs, sales goals and budgets to optimise profit.
* Actively seek opportunities to increase the selling
* Train, develop and inspire your team.
* Set an example for your team by always acting in line with H&M Group values, H&M Home brand DNA and H&M Group Global leadership principles.
* Ensure best practice of store activities and back office procedures.


**Additional Information**
**We are looking for a strong and passionate leader who thrives in a fastmoving environment where the customers is always in focus. You coach and guide your team to together reach your goals.**
**Your skills should include:**
* Fluent in Swedish & English – writing and speaking to communicate with all levels in the business.
* Passion for customer service.
* Coaching and development mindset of your team.
* Interior design interest and work experience in an interior store.
* Experience leading large teams (20 employees +)
* Result driven attitude.
* Proactive in taking commercial actions everyday
* Well-organised and able to cope with a large workload.
* Planning and prioritising to reach your goals.
* Analytical and reflective mindset to constantly improve store profitability.

title: Business Director
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Business Director to EssenceMediacom**
 We are currently seeking an experienced and visionary Business Director for our marketing agency. This key role focuses on driving new business growth, expanding our existing client relationships, and leading and developing a high-performing team. The ideal candidate has over 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm and demonstrates outstanding drive, commitment, and a proven track record in client relations, business development, and team leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Business Development:**
* Identify and drive new business opportunities by leveraging market insights and industry trends.
* Build and nurture strong relationships with prospective clients to understand their needs and highlight the agency's unique value.
* Create and deliver strategic presentations and commercial proposals to attract potential clients.


**Client Relationship Development:**
* Oversee and strengthen relationships with existing clients by aligning media strategies with their evolving needs.
* Regularly review client campaigns and provide strategic insights and recommendations for improvements.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for key clients, fostering long-term, trust-based partnerships.


**Team Leadership and Personnel Management:**
* Lead, guide, and develop the client team, focusing on both individual and team growth.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, professional development, and excellence within the team.
* Implement effective team structures and processes to ensure efficient client service and career development opportunities for employees.
* Regularly assess and address the team’s training and career development needs in alignment with the agency’s strategic goals.


**Strategic Planning and Execution:**
* Contribute to the agency’s strategic planning with a focus on driving clients' overall business objectives.
* Monitor industry trends and competitor activities and adapt strategies to maintain competitive advantages.
* Ensure the use of innovative and effective media solutions in client campaigns.


**Qualifications And Experience**
* At least 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm with a proven track record in growth-driven business development and team leadership.
* Strong leadership skills and experience in personnel management and team development.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships.
* Strategic and analytical thinking, capable of solving complex problems.
* Deep understanding of media planning, media buying, and digital strategies.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, communication, or a related field. Advanced degrees or professional certifications are an advantage.


**Personal Attributes**
* Highly driven and engaged, with a passion for media, client success, and team development.
* Creative and innovative thinker who continuously seeks ways to improve services and enhance client satisfaction.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.
* Adaptable and flexible, thriving in a fast-paced and evolving industry.


**What We Offer**
* A dynamic, collaborative work environment with a team of dedicated professionals.
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.


 The Business Director will play a crucial role in shaping the agency’s future, driving growth, ensuring the highest level of service for our clients, and fostering an environment where team members can thrive and succeed. If you are a motivated leader with a passion for media, client success, and talent development, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**About EssenceMediacom**
 We are a leading global marketing and media agency and a part of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company. EssenceMediacom combines creativity, innovation, and data-driven strategy to help brands achieve their business goals and build strong connections with their target audiences. With expertise in marketing strategy, media planning, buying, and media optimization, the agency delivers tailored solutions that generate measurable results.
   

  

 As part of GroupM, EssenceMediacom has access to an extensive network and resources, making it a strategic partner for companies aiming to stay ahead in an ever-changing marketing landscape.
   

  

 EssenceMediacom has offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg and fosters a culture built on the belief that everything begins and ends with people. We take pride in working with exciting brands such as Tele2, Klarna, Byggmax, adidas, Kjell & Company, Coca-Cola, Bayer, and Google.
   

  

**Application**
 Selections are made continuously, so please upload your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Morten Flamand, CEO at EssenceMediacom, at morten.flamand@essencemediacom.com.

title: Solution Architect – Prevent & Protect Platforms
description:
Are you ready to be part of a robust product area that protects vital information and manages attack surface exposure? Then this could be an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Sandvik Group IT, we’re now looking for a Solution Architect for Prevent & Protect Platforms to join us. We welcome you to become part of our engineering-minded community of product teams dedicated to excellence in cybersecurity – let’s innovate and secure the digital world together!
   

  

**About Us**
 The Cybersecurity Engineering product area consists of four key product teams: Prevent & Protect Platforms, Attack Surface Management, Secure Network and Application Access, and Detect & Respond Platforms. We’re at the forefront of delivering secure access solutions with integrated detection and response. Together, these teams drive continuous improvement and ensure efficient operations of global cybersecurity platforms across the Sandvik Group.
   

  

**Your new team**
 The Prevent and Protect Platforms product team within our cybersecurity organization delivers capabilities in data security, risk and compliance and data governance. We enable our end users, business and technology teams as well as security and risk professionals to effectively secure and govern data across its lifecycle, and to identify and prevent risky behaviors to protect information.
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this position, you’re responsible for leading and coordinating the technology development of our Prevent & Protect Platform products, creating feasible technical solutions, and ensuring alignment with business needs and strategies.
   

  

 Important parts of your mission:
   

  

* Create and sustain solution designs that meet business expectations.
* Research emerging technologies and propose changes to existing solution architecture.
* Develop and anchor a technology roadmap aligned with our Product Area’s direction.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand both their needs and context.


 The location for this position is Stockholm or Sandviken and we apply a hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine office and remote work.
   

  

**About You**
 We’re looking for someone with proven experience as a Solution Architect, preferably in a larger global organization. You have experience of cybersecurity, information security, information classification and data loss prevention capabilities and technologies. Knowledge of the full capabilities in Microsoft Purview E5 is considered a plus. You have a relevant education, or equivalent knowledge gained from a working career. Acting in a truly global environment calls for profound communication skills in English. Knowledge in Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 Your personality truly makes the difference – you have excellent stakeholder management and communication skills. Being creative and adaptable, you thrive in an ever-changing environment. You’re eager to learn and are a true team player who values collaboration and sharing best practices.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Petra Englund, recruiting manager, petra.englund@sandvik.com.
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We have an ongoing recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than May 25, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0070638.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.*

title: CRM Manager (Vikariat)
description:
Känns uttrycket “rädda planeten” mest som en klyscha? Hos oss är det faktiskt exakt det vi jobbar för att göra. Svea Solar är idag störst i Sverige inom solenergilösningar och vi fortsätter växa med sikte på att bli störst i Europa 🚀 Om vi lyckas med det, innebär det att vi kommer säkerställa egenproducerad solenergi till miljontals hushåll.
   

  

 För att lyckas med vårt mål behöver vi få med oss rätt personer på resan och det är här du kommer in i bilden. Vi söker nu en affärsdriven CRM Manager till vår svenska marknadsavdelning på vikariat då vår kollega går på föräldraledighet med start i juni och ca 10 månader framåt.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 I rollen som CRM Manager ansvarar du för att leda och planera arbetet med Svea Solars kunddialog och kundrelationer på den svenska marknaden. Som CRM Manager kommer du aktivt bidra till utvecklingen av våra marknads- och CRM-aktiviteter genom att bygga och utveckla kommunikationsflöden som skapar affärsvärde och kundnöjdhet för befintliga såväl som potentiella kunder.
   

  

 Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med det svenska marknadsteamet och övriga interna intressenter såsom säljavdelningen och IT.
   

  

 Du förväntas arbeta hållbart och i linje med Svea Solars värderingar, samt upprätthålla en hög servicenivå gentemot andra avdelningar. Tillsammans med teamet bidrar du aktivt till att utveckla våra arbetssätt, driva gemensamma mål framåt och skapa en stark, värderingsstyrd kultur inom marknadsföring och kundrelationer.
   

  

 Här kommer en klassisk punktlista över arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ansvar för målsättning, planer och taktiker avseende CRM och kunddialog/marketing automation på den svenska marknaden
* Ansvar för kunddialog till potentiella såväl som befintliga kunder genom Svea Solars CRM-system (Marketing Cloud). Dialogen sker primärt via mejl, men även via sms
* Genomföra kund- och målgruppsanalyser av kunddatabasen i syfte att proaktivt utveckla och optimera bolagets arbete med kundrelationer, försäljning och merförsäljning
* Ansvar för att hålla kundresan för olika produkter och tjänster dokumenterad och aktuell
* Aktivt arbeta för att öka Svea Solars varumärkescommunity och kundlojalitet
* Aktivt bidra till att stärka Svea Solars närvaro och omdömen på externa plattformar, exempelvis genom att öka kundbetyg och recensioner
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om relevanta händelser som sker i omvärlden inom CRM och marknadskommunikation


 Är vi en match?
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du är en lagspelare likt oss, med kunddialog (och vår planet! 🌎) nära hjärtat. Vi söker dig som är en affärsdriven CRM-ansvarig med erfarenhet av datadriven marknadsföring och att optimera kundupplevelsen. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du motiveras av att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö där du i mycket driver din egen agenda och skapar dina egna förutsättningar. Du är en analytisk problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta egna beslut.
   

  

 Med det sagt, är det några saker vi ser som viktiga för att lyckas i rollen:
   

  

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att arbeta med CRM, kunddialog samt kund- och målgruppsanalys
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* God vana av Marketing Cloud, erfarenhet av Salesforce är meriterande


 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Med en stark övertygelse att solenergi är den bästa lösningen på klimatkrisen, grundades Svea Solar i en liten lägenhet i Solna utanför Stockholm 2014. Då sattes det syfte som gäller än idag – att leda vägen mot en hållbar framtid med solenergi.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett arbetsklimat med högt i tak och en formbar utveckling för dig som anställd. Vi tror långsiktigt på marknaden för solceller och vi investerar därför långsiktigt i våra medarbetares utveckling. Svea Solar är en arbetsplats där du kan växa med företaget.
   

  

 Vill du bli vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 Skicka då in din ansökan redan idag! Du kan enkelt söka tjänsten med din LinkedIn-profil. Vi gör urval och intervjuar löpande för denna tjänst.
   

  

 Mångfald och inkludering
   

  

 Vi på Svea Solar tror att mångfald och olika erfarenheter bidrar till den kreativitet som krävs för att utveckla branschen. Vi värdesätter därför en jämn könsfördelning och vår ambition är att rekrytera medarbetare från olika bakgrunder för att representera samhället och våra kunder.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll
   

  

 För slutkandidat gör vi bakgrundskontroll av belastningsregister för att säkerställa att alla våra anställda har en bakgrund som är förenlig med Svea Solars värdegrund.

title: System Architect ASIC
description:
**Join our Team**
**Our Exciting Opportunity**
 Do you want to develop advanced silicon technology with cutting-edge innovation in a single chip? Then look no further! The product engineering unit Silicon drives the development of industry-leading digital ASIC technologies, with vibrant technology hubs across multiple sites. We are looking for experienced system architects for system-on-chip development who will drive the innovation of our digital ASIC products in the ever-evolving world of telecommunications.
   

  

 As an experienced member of our Silicon Systems & Architecture department, you bring skills and insight that will be instrumental in ensuring the delivery of high-quality system solutions that shape the future of global connectivity. In this role, you will be more than an engineer; you play a pivotal role in which you lead, innovate, and ensure that the product features are systemised into functional requirements and brought into our digital ASIC IPs. Your expertise will be critical for turning game-changing ideas into real-world solutions shaping the 5G and 6G eras.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive silicon functional systemization activities of radio functions, features, interfaces, configuration capabilities, and sub-systems, that are to be implemented in ASIC function architecture blocks.
* Act as lead architect to develop ASIC requirement specifications for radio signal processing..
* Innovate concepts for functional features by participating or driving pre-development studies aligned with future product needs for ASIC systemization.
* Systemize and architect hardware solutions for product features by breaking down system requirements from product to ASIC function level and sub-system level.
* Stay up to date on key industry trends, academic research, technology standards and development in the System-on-Chip domain and spread the acquired knowledge across the silicon systems community (e.g. in form of feature roadmaps).


**We are currently looking to strengthen areas with the following disciplines:**
* Radio control, incl. event control, beam control, complex data (IQ) control, and key peripheral sub-systems such as processors, memories, security, etc.
* Radio measurement and supervision, incl. antenna calibration, test memories, power monitoring, interconnects such as JESD204, etc.


**The skills you bring:**
* Experience in radio systemization and relevant disciplines for any of the above-mentioned areas that we are looking to strengthen.
* Master of Science, Ph.D., Post-doc, or similar degrees in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering Physics, or equivalent education.
* Proficiency within the field of signal processing, telecommunication systems, radio technology and preferably the silicon domain.
* Knowledge about system-on-chip development, embedded systems, and ASIC or IP development.
* Knowledge of wireless standards (e.g. GSM, WCDMA, LTE, NR) under the 3gpp umbrella, as well as network standards (e.g. IEEE 802, etc.).
* Strong communication skills, with a focus on documentation (e.g. authoring requirement specifications) and the ability to drive complex technical discussions to a solution.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Performance Marketing Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
 As a
 **Performance Marketing Designer** 
 , you will play a crucial role in the Brand Creative team supporting our marketing efforts. Your role will be to produce high-impact advertising materials that drive consideration and conversion for our mid & lower-funnel campaigns.
   

  

 This role is critical to customer acquisition, directly impacting commercial results and targets. It supports the growth marketing objectives by delivering visually engaging designs that convert. Your work will have a tangible impact on our commercial success, enhancing the effectiveness of our advertising campaigns and driving customer growth. You'll be part of the Brand Creative team, collaborating closely with designers, copywriters, and other creatives.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Conceptualise and execute compelling visual assets for mid & lower-funnel advertising campaigns.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive and effective messaging.
* Translate growth marketing objectives into persuasive designs that drive conversions.
* Maintain brand consistency while pushing creative boundaries.
* Optimise creatives based on performance data (CTR, VR, ROAS, CPA).


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in motion and graphic design, with a focus on lower-funnel advertising creative.
* Proven experience in designing high-performing ads for Google, Meta (Facebook/Instagram), TikTok, and other paid media platforms.
* Ability to understand creative performance data and interpret key advertising metrics.
* Hands-on experience with tools like Smartly.io or similar for developing automated ad-creatives.
* Expert proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong passion for advertising and motivated by the impact of creative work.
* Enjoys the craft of advertising and stays inspired by industry trends.
* Self-directed and able to work with minimal supervision.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Account Executive SMB
description:
**Description**
 What We’re Looking For:
   

  

 Excited about the prospect of stepping into the
 **Account Executive SMB** 
 role with us at Meltwater? We're on the lookout for individuals like yourself to join our dynamic team and drive the initiation of new business ventures. As an
 **Account Executive SMB** 
 , your pivotal role lies in securing new business within our small to medium market segment. You will learn a deep understanding of Meltwater's value proposition and will navigate through all phases of the sales cycle.
   

  

 At Meltwater, it's not just about your position—it's an invitation to explore personal and professional growth opportunities. Immerse yourself in an environment that fosters skill development, encourages mentorship, and champions inclusive leadership. Collaborate closely with experienced professionals and inspirational leaders who are dedicated to supporting you every step of the way.
   

  

 Join our community, and you'll find a culture that celebrates your uniqueness and empowers you to unlock your full potential. Let's embark on this collective journey and redefine how we approach driving new business at Meltwater!
   

  

 What You'll Do:
   

  

* Embrace the role of a 360 seller within the dynamic SMB landscape, proactively identifying and targeting potential new Meltwater customers
* Meet or exceed quarterly sales quotas by effectively identifying and targeting potential new Meltwater customers.
* Utilize thorough discovery processes to qualify leads and prioritize efforts towards high-value opportunities.
* Consistently deliver engaging demonstrations and persuasive sales presentations, to captivate audiences and convert leads into customers.
* Proactively manage contract negotiations to secure agreements that meet both customer requirements and company objectives.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams such as Customer Success and Sales Operations to guarantee a seamless process for our clients.
* Regularly assess progress towards quarterly goals and adjust strategies as needed to maintain momentum and achieve targets.


 What You'll Bring:
   

  

* A Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred for this role, allowing you to leverage your academic strengths.
* A minimum of 1 year of experience in business-to-business sales is required, with a demonstrated success in new business development.
* Proficiency in negotiation tactics is essential, coupled with the ability to articulate intricate value propositions persuasively.
* Proven track record of being results-driven, consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Proactive approach towards executing targeted outreach initiatives and generating leads.
* Strong organizational prowess, including adept management of the customer purchase process and skillful negotiation of contract terms.
* Collaborative mindset, with the ability to effectively coordinate efforts with internal teams to ensure successful implementation.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Willingness to embrace the best of both worlds with our hybrid work schedule. This role requires you to be in the office 3 days a week
* The ability to legally work in the country of hire is required for this position.


****What We Offer:****
* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


**Where You'll Work: Brahegatan 10 7tr, 114 37 Stockholm, Sweden**
 Our Story
   

  

 At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right environment, great things happen.
   

  

 Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around
   

  

 the world to make better business decisions through data. But we can’t do that without our global team of developers, innovators, problem-solvers, and high-performers who embrace challenges and find new solutions for our customers.
   

  

 Our award-winning global culture drives everything we do and creates
   

  

 an environment where our employees can make an impact, learn every day, feel a sense of belonging, and celebrate each other’s successes along
   

  

 the way.
   

  

 We are innovators at the core who see the potential in people, ideas and technologies. Together, we challenge ourselves to go big, be bold, and build best-in-class solutions for our customers.
   

  

 We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,200+ employees in 50 locations across
   

  

 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to unlock new heights in your career.
   

  

 We are Meltwater. Inspired by innovation, powered by people.
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
   

  

 Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.
   

  

 All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.
   

  

 Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.

title: Sektionschef-sektionen för systemutveckling
description:
**Regeringskansliets enhet för Utveckling**
 Förvaltningsavdelningens verksamhet är sedan 1 september 2024 indelad i sex avdelningar. Flera av avdelningarna har genomgått en omorganisation som trätt i kraft vid årsskiftet. Nu rekryteras till nya befattningar som enhetschefer och sektionschefer vid dessa avdelningar. Digitaliseringsavdelningen består sedan årsskiftet av fyra enheter. En enhet för drift och underhåll, en enhet för utveckling, en enhet för teknisk styrning och innovation samt enheten kontaktcenter.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Vi söker nu en sektionschef till sektionen för systemutveckling. Som chef leder du sektionens arbete och ansvarar för dess planering samt uppföljning av resultat och ekonomiskt utfall. I rollen ingår budget, verksamhets- och personalansvar och du främjar god arbetsmiljö, jämställdhet och kompetensutveckling för sektionens personal. Du ingår i enhetsledningen och är en del av enhetens chefsgrupp där du aktivt bidrar till förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete.
   

  

 Sektionen för systemförvaltning har 8 medarbetare och ett flertal konsulter. Sektionen ansvarar för att leverera strukturerad och kvalitativ systemutveckling inom projekt och förvaltningsaktiviteter för att leverera strukturerad och kvalitativ systemutveckling inom projekt och förvaltningsaktiviteter. Sektionen ansvarar vidare för arbetssätt och processer inom området systemutveckling. Stora IT-plattformar vi har är bl.a. Pega och BMC Smart IT. Sektionen ansvarar även för arbetssätt och processer inom området systemutveckling. Sektionens leveranser ska bidra till att myndigheten får systemlösningar som ger önskad verksamhetsnytta och som förenklar och effektiviserar vardagen för medarbetarna i organisationen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande utveckling av både arbetssätt, kompetens, leverans- och organisationsindelning varför gruppens ansvarsområden kan komma att justeras över tid. I din roll bidrar du till effektivisering genom att verka för en miljö som stimulerar till samarbete samt utveckla sektionens del i enhetens gemensamma arbetssätt och leveranser i takt med förändrade verksamhetsbehov och it-branschens utbud. Som sektionschef företräder du också verksamheten i många olika sammanhang, såväl internt som externt.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom för tjänsten relevant område eller annan lämplig utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer vara relevant för befattningen. Har du även genomgott relevanta ledarskapsutbildningar är det meriterande. Du har även erfarenhet av en chefsroll inom relevant IT-område med leverans-, personal- och budgetansvar. Vi ser även att du har erfarenhet av kund/ användardrivet utvecklingsarbete inom IT/digitalisering. Rollen kräver även erfarenhet av portföljstyrning med avseende på resurstilldelning, prioritering och uppföljning. Vidare har du kunskap och förståelse i förvaltningsmodeller, gärna PM3 samt kunskap om ITIL. Rollen kräver även kunskap om och förståelse för agila utvecklings-metoder.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av relevant arbete inom Regeringskansliets IT- och digitaliseringsavdelning. Det är även meriterande med erfarenhet av förändringsledning samt med kunskap om projektledning. Vidare är det meriterande med erfarenhet av avtalsförvaltning och offentliga upphandlingar. Du behöver kunna uttrycka dig mycket väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 I rollen som sektionschef behöver du ha god ledarförmåga och du skapar engagemang och delaktighet. Som ledare visar du tillit genom att coacha och delegera, för att generera lösningar och frigöra medarbetares potential. Du har en förmåga att skapa förtroendefullt samarbete på alla nivåer både internt och externt. Du har även en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga samt att du värdesätter goda relationer. Som ledare har du även förmåga att omsätta uppsatta övergripande mål till praktisk handling och resultat samt att du har en problemlösande och analytisk förmåga. Du har även en vilja att utvecklas och lära nytt och är initiativrik som person. Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Du anställs tillsvidare med ett tidsbegränsat förordnande som chef. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta tf enhetschef Sofia Tingåker på 08- 405 82 94. Du är också välkommen att kontakta rekryteringsspecialist Siri Hågefalk på 08-405 87 83. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Jan Wahlströmför för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den** 
**21:a maj.**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: CRM Manager (Vikariat)
description:
Känns uttrycket “rädda planeten” mest som en klyscha? Hos oss är det faktiskt exakt det vi jobbar för att göra. Svea Solar är idag störst i Sverige inom solenergilösningar och vi fortsätter växa med sikte på att bli störst i Europa 🚀 Om vi lyckas med det, innebär det att vi kommer säkerställa egenproducerad solenergi till miljontals hushåll.
   

  

 För att lyckas med vårt mål behöver vi få med oss rätt personer på resan och det är här du kommer in i bilden. Vi söker nu en affärsdriven CRM Manager till vår svenska marknadsavdelning på vikariat då vår kollega går på föräldraledighet med start i juni och ca 10 månader framåt.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 I rollen som CRM Manager ansvarar du för att leda och planera arbetet med Svea Solars kunddialog och kundrelationer på den svenska marknaden. Som CRM Manager kommer du aktivt bidra till utvecklingen av våra marknads- och CRM-aktiviteter genom att bygga och utveckla kommunikationsflöden som skapar affärsvärde och kundnöjdhet för befintliga såväl som potentiella kunder.
   

  

 Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med det svenska marknadsteamet och övriga interna intressenter såsom säljavdelningen och IT.
   

  

 Du förväntas arbeta hållbart och i linje med Svea Solars värderingar, samt upprätthålla en hög servicenivå gentemot andra avdelningar. Tillsammans med teamet bidrar du aktivt till att utveckla våra arbetssätt, driva gemensamma mål framåt och skapa en stark, värderingsstyrd kultur inom marknadsföring och kundrelationer.
   

  

**Här Kommer En Klassisk Punktlista Över Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ansvar för målsättning, planer och taktiker avseende CRM och kunddialog/marketing automation på den svenska marknaden
* Ansvar för kunddialog till potentiella såväl som befintliga kunder genom Svea Solars CRM-system (Marketing Cloud). Dialogen sker primärt via mejl, men även via sms
* Genomföra kund- och målgruppsanalyser av kunddatabasen i syfte att proaktivt utveckla och optimera bolagets arbete med kundrelationer, försäljning och merförsäljning
* Ansvar för att hålla kundresan för olika produkter och tjänster dokumenterad och aktuell
* Aktivt arbeta för att öka Svea Solars varumärkescommunity och kundlojalitet
* Aktivt bidra till att stärka Svea Solars närvaro och omdömen på externa plattformar, exempelvis genom att öka kundbetyg och recensioner
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om relevanta händelser som sker i omvärlden inom CRM och marknadskommunikation


 Är vi en match?
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du är en lagspelare likt oss, med kunddialog (och vår planet! 🌎) nära hjärtat. Vi söker dig som är en affärsdriven CRM-ansvarig med erfarenhet av datadriven marknadsföring och att optimera kundupplevelsen. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du motiveras av att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö där du i mycket driver din egen agenda och skapar dina egna förutsättningar. Du är en analytisk problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta egna beslut.
   

  

 Med det sagt, är det några saker vi ser som viktiga för att lyckas i rollen:
   

  

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att arbeta med CRM, kunddialog samt kund- och målgruppsanalys
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* God vana av Marketing Cloud, erfarenhet av Salesforce är meriterande


 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Med en stark övertygelse att solenergi är den bästa lösningen på klimatkrisen, grundades Svea Solar i en liten lägenhet i Solna utanför Stockholm 2014. Då sattes det syfte som gäller än idag – att leda vägen mot en hållbar framtid med solenergi.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett arbetsklimat med högt i tak och en formbar utveckling för dig som anställd. Vi tror långsiktigt på marknaden för solceller och vi investerar därför långsiktigt i våra medarbetares utveckling. Svea Solar är en arbetsplats där du kan växa med företaget.
   

  

 Vill du bli vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 Skicka då in din ansökan redan idag! Du kan enkelt söka tjänsten med din LinkedIn-profil. Vi gör urval och intervjuar löpande för denna tjänst.
   

  

 Mångfald och inkludering
   

  

 Vi på Svea Solar tror att mångfald och olika erfarenheter bidrar till den kreativitet som krävs för att utveckla branschen. Vi värdesätter därför en jämn könsfördelning och vår ambition är att rekrytera medarbetare från olika bakgrunder för att representera samhället och våra kunder.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll
   

  

 För slutkandidat gör vi bakgrundskontroll av belastningsregister för att säkerställa att alla våra anställda har en bakgrund som är förenlig med Svea Solars värdegrund.

title: Controller
company_industry: Research Services, Non-profit Organizations, and Environmental Services
description:
Vi söker nu efter en Controller till Stockholm Environment Institute (SEI). Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en utvecklande roll i en internationell forskningsmiljö tillsammans med engagerade kollegor. Vill du vara med och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid? Då vill vi gärna höra från dig!
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som controller kommer du att arbeta nära projektledare med projektansökningar och budgetering samt finansiell uppföljning, rapportering och revision. Rollen innebär även utformning av lämpliga processer och system för finansiell planering och uppföljning som är relevanta för de specifika projekten.
 



  





 Du kommer att ingå i ett controlling-team på tre personer och rapportera till SEI:s Director of Finance and Operations. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bl.a. att innefatta:
