 765839

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Är du en lagspelare som vill ta steget upp till landslaget? Just nu söker vi en lösningsarkitekt till Atea Sverige. Det är önskvärt om du bor nära ett av våra kontor, det kan till exempel vara
 **Malmö, Göteborg, Stockholm, Borlänge** 
**eller Umeå** 
 .
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med it, medarbetare som tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Du kommer jobba tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor som är väldigt engagerade och beslutsamma i att tillsammans, bygga Sverige med IT!
   

  

**Din roll**
 I tjänsten som lösningsarkitekt kommer du att arbeta med många olika kunder och branscher - i Sverige och Norden. Du kommer att arbeta med hela affärsprocessen, från kvalificering till färdig tjänsteleverans. Dina arbetsuppgifter består primärt av att inspirera vårt säljteam med att använda Cloud-lösningar baserade på vår globala tjänsteportfölj och du företräder även rollen att identifiera behov och krav som utmanar vår leveransorganisation.
   

  

 Du kommer ta ram rätt lösning till våra kunder och vara ytterst ansvarig för att arkitekturen både håller kundens förväntansnivå samt levereras med kvalitet. Som verktyg har du tillgång till en bred portfölj av tjänster och en kompetent driftorganisation och du arbetar med managed services för både Public Cloud, Private Cloud och on-prem. Resor kan ingå i tjänsten.
   

  

 Du erbjuds en utvecklande roll där du arbetar tillsammans med hela Atea Sveriges sälj- och konsultorganisation och bidrar till att skapa den förflyttning mot cloud som just nu pågår på marknaden. Du lever efter Ateas värderingar och brinner för att skapa skillnad tillsammans med mer än 2 500 härliga kollegor varje dag.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person har du ett kundfokus i allt du gör och tar lätt till dig nya arbetsuppgifter. Du räds inte att företräda ny teknologi i oprövade sammanhang och du har en förmåga att sätta dig in i, förstå och förmedla kundvärdet. Du är ansvarstagande och drivs av att få saker gjorda och du trivs med att stå på scen och förmedla vårt budskap.
   

  

**För att lyckas i tjänsten som lösningsarkitekt tror vi du har följande:**
* Tidigare har arbetat som till exempel teknisk account manager, solution arkitekt, solution manager eller som applikationsarkitekt eller liknande och besitter därmed en bred teknisk bakgrund
* Har teknisk kunskap inom Cloud och IT-infrastruktur
* Välutvecklat affärsmannaskap och ett sinne för försäljning
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Har möjlighet att resa i tjänsten när det behövs


**Om Atea Managed Services**
 På Atea Managed Services är vi experter på IT-drift. Oavsett om våra kunder vill outsourca delar av eller hela IT-driften, är vi deras föredragna driftspartner. Vi hjälper till att frigöra resurser och öka den övergripande effektiviteten i deras IT-organisationer. Detta gör vi genom att leverera kostnadseffektiva driftstjänster med högsta kvalitet, oavsett kundens plattformsbehov. Detta kan innebära i kundens eget datacenter, på offentliga molnplattformar eller i vårt eget Atea Cloud. Atea Managed Services finns i fem länder och mer än 1 500 anställda arbetar inom affärsområdet. Vi har driftspersonal i tjänst dygnet runt
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänstens innehåll eller hur det är att arbeta på Atea är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Urban Järved, Manager for Solution Management, via urban.jarved@atea.se +46 72 712 76 88. Jag hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför alla samtal och eventuella förslag från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.
   

  

 Som en del i Ateas rekryteringsprocess ingår bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat. Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Digital Workplace Technician
description:
**Digital Workplace Technician, Älvsjö** 




  





 Are you a tech-savvy problem solver with a passion for Microsoft 365 and Intune? Do you thrive on creating innovative solutions and driving change? Join Hydroscand as a Digital Workplace Technician and take your career to the next level!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 As a Digital Workplace Technician at Hydroscand, you will be at the forefront of maintaining and developing cutting-edge digital workplace solutions. Your expertise will ensure our end-users across 20 countries have a seamless and secure experience. You will act as a support resource for 2nd and 3rd line issues, with significant opportunities to drive change and projects within the area. The role also serves as an interface to the business in matters related to the Digital Workplace.
 



  





 You will work extensively in cloud environments, primarily with the Microsoft 365 platform and Intune. Our clients consist of Windows 10/11, iOS, and Android. However, we also have some on-prem systems such as Active Directory and print solutions that you will need to manage. Regardless of the system, security is of utmost importance, and you will play a crucial role in maintaining a high level of security around our identities and devices.
 



  





 Our users are located in 20 different countries and work in various environments such as offices, factories, stores, service buses, warehouses, etc. it is therefore important to understand their needs and adapt the solution accordingly. This role may involve occasional travel within Sweden and internationally, providing you with opportunities to collaborate with our global teams and gain diverse experience.
 



  





 In addition to having great colleagues, you will have access to external area experts whom you can consult or escalate to when needed, but it is your responsibility to use these resources cost-effectively and in line with our strategies.
 



  





**We offer** 




 A fun, fast-paced work environment with a
 **welcoming and team-oriented atmosphere** 
 where we help each other make a difference.
 



  





 Our renovated new
 **head office in Älvsjö** 
 is equipped with
 **modern facilities** 
 , including a
 **gym,** 
 a
 **masseur** 
 available for booking and
 **weekly swedish fredagsfika** 
 , ensuring a healthy work-life balance and promoting well-being for our employees.
 



  





 At Hydroscand, we care about our employees and offer both internal and external training. You will have opportunities for growth within a Swedish family-owned company operating in 20 countries globally.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




 We are looking for someone who is ambitious and interested in growing in their role. You have a strong desire to develop and are eager to learn new things. You are not afraid to take initiative and drive change. You are a team player who can collaborate effectively with others and maintain a positive attitude towards challenges and opportunities. Your curiosity and commitment drive you to continuously improve and optimize work processes and solutions.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* At least 1 year of experience working with administration in Microsoft 365, Intune, and Windows 10/11.
* Good understanding of cybersecurity concepts.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* ITIL knowledge and experience with processes such as incident, problem, and change.



  





 If you are ambitious, eager to learn, and ready to make a difference, apply now to join our fun and innovative team at Hydroscand!

title: Senior Product Manager - User Fraud
description:
We’re looking for a passionate Senior Product Manager to join the User Fraud R&D Studio at Spotify to help us protect our platform against the impact of artificial activity. We work to detect and prevent artificial accounts, behaviour and streaming activity across all of Spotify’s business areas and, as such, this is an exciting team with a diverse set of evolving challenges to overcome.
   

  

 This team works to prevent abusive behaviours at the earliest possible stages and, as such, utilises some of the most exciting technologies across the disciplines of data science, data engineering and machine learning.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Develop and implement a product strategy to reduce and prevent artificial behaviours on our platform.
* Work closely with our team of data scientists and machine learning engineers to fight back against artificial activity wherever it’s found.
* Collaborate closely with a broad range of stakeholders from across Spotify including from within our studio and several large areas we partner with.
* Engage in exciting research across Spotify’s latest product areas to understand and prevent potential vectors of abuse.
* Partner with the rest of the studio to ensure our work is having the impact we’d expect and implement strategies to pivot when it isn’t.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You’re an experienced Product Manager keen to work in a non-traditional product space, we’re out here to prevent fraud rather than designing or shipping features.
* A confident and passionate communicator ready to jump into difficult conversations, build bridges to enable new areas of collaboration and the ability to crack some bad jokes when the chips are down.
* You have led the product work within large tech companies that you can tell us about.
* You have experience working in the field of fraud prevention, with expertise in deriving insights from a broad array of data sources and creating strategy based on them.
* Somebody excited by an ever-evolving problem space and an understanding that there’s no silver bullet to prevent fraud!


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
***Senior Fullstack Engineer***




  





**Application Deadline:** 
 June 30, 2025
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Gdansk, Oslo
 



  





**Join Simployer as a Senior Fullstack Engineer (backend focus)** 




 Simployer is transforming HR tech, and we are on the lookout for an experienced Senior Fullstack Engineer to help us build a world-class platform. As part of the growing team, you will work with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative features that will be used by organizations across Europe. Join us in shaping the future of HR technology as we continue to revolutionize the industry with AI-powered solutions, seamless HR systems, and exceptional user experiences.
 



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Collaborative Culture** 
 – Join a supportive, dynamic team dedicated to learning and growth.
* **Professional Development** 
 – Access opportunities to expand your skills and grow within the organization.
* **Competitive Compensation** 
 – Enjoy a market-aligned salary and benefits package.
* **Real Impact** 
 – Make a significant impact on our products, clients, and business.



  





**About the Role** 




**Skills & Requirements** 




**What You Will Do:** 



* Drive the development of key features across the full stack, with a strong focus on designing and implementing robust and scalable backend solutions.
* Build new features from scratch, improve existing code, and ensure it remains clean, scalable, and efficient.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the product meets both business and user needs.
* Take ownership of your work and contribute autonomously while driving product development forward.
* Contribute to system architecture design, ensuring stability and scalability as the product evolves.



  





**What You Will Bring to the Team:** 



* Strong proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **TypeScript** 
 .
* Advanced understanding with
 **NestJS** 
 framework and
 **MongoDB** 
 .
* Solid experience in
 **REST,** 
**GraphQL APIs, unit and integration tests using Jest.**
* Experience with
 **Redis** 
 ,
 **RabbitMQ** 
 , and/or other similar technologies in the stack.
* Experience working with
 **React** 
 frontend.
* Experience developing production-grade applications, with a strong understanding of
 **API design** 
 (server-to-server, server-to-client).
* Expertise in
 **data modeling** 
 , and working with
 **cloud platforms** 
 such as
 **GCP** 
 ,
 **AWS** 
 , or
 **Azure** 
 . Experience in
 **Kubernetes** 
 and
 **microservice architecture** 
 are also favourable.
* Ability to maintain high coding standards and contribute to a collaborative, agile development environment.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A passion for building innovative software and contributing to a thriving development culture.



  





**What We See as a Plus:** 



* Experience working with AI/ML technologies in a backend context.
* Experience in the
 **HR** 
**Tech** 
 or
 **SaaS** 
 industries.
* Knowledge of
 **Integration Testing** 
 and
 **TDD** 
 practices.



  





**Our Tech Stack:** 



* Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, MongoDB/Mongoose, GraphQL, REST, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jest, Kubernetes, microservices, GCP



  





**Message from the Hiring Manager:** 




*“Hi! I'm Herman, the Engineering Manager for the HR Core team. In this role you will be working closely with myself and a team of talented, passionate individuals dedicated to delivering high-quality products for our customers.* 




  





*At Simployer, I was welcomed into a culture of innovation and creative freedom, a work environment that encourages our team members to question the status quo and learn from their mistakes. So now I would like to extend this forward to yourself as well.* 




  





*I look forward to learning more about you, and how you can contribute to our success."* 




  





**Why Join Simployer?** 




 By joining Simployer, you’ll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You’ll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We’re building something big — join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we’ll change the HR tech game!
 



  





**Our Hiring Process:** 



1. **Introduction meeting:** 
 A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn more about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).
2. **Personality & Logic Test:** 
 A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs
3. **Technical Screening:** 
 Meet with Herman, our Engineering Manager, for a technical discussion to assess your experience and skills (approx. 45 minutes).
4. **Technical Interview:** 
 A deeper dive into your technical expertise with Herman, our Engineering Manager, and other tech leaders, and for you to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).
5. **Informal HR Interview** 
 : Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



  





**We can’t wait to meet you!** 




 At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Duyen Nguyen
 



 duyen.nguyen@simployer.com

title: Co-Founding CTO
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Management
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
Ready to build your startup and get funded in 10 weeks? We’re a global early-stage VC backing founders from day zero. We invest up to €400k through our founder residency – a building sprint where you leverage community, sparring, and intense effort to make 1 year of progress in 10 weeks.
 



  





**About Antler** 




  





 Join the next Nordics residency starting
 **September 1st, 2025, in Stockholm** 
 . Build your company alongside a cohort of pre-vetted, exceptional potential co-founders, validate your ideas, engage with customers, develop your MVP, refine your business model, and create your go-to-market strategy before pitching to the investment committee.
 



  





**Who Makes a Great Technical Founder?** 




  





 As a technical founder, your expertise in software engineering, AI/ML, data science, or deep tech will be critical in building and scaling a venture-backed startup. You might be:
 



  




* A CTO or senior engineering leader ready to transition from building for others to founding your own company.
* A deep tech or AI/ML expert with a vision for how emerging technologies can solve critical problems.
* A full-stack or backend engineer eager to take ownership of a product from zero to one.
* A technical architect or hands-on builder who thrives on solving complex technical challenges at scale.



  





**Founder DNA: What Sets You Apart?** 




  





 Beyond technical ability, the best startup CTOs have:
 



  




* Inner drive – You have a vision for what you want to build and the ambition to execute.
* Creative problem-solving – You don’t just code; you build scalable systems and innovative solutions.
* Grit – You thrive in uncertainty, iterate quickly, and push through technical and business challenges.



  





**The Antler Founder Residency:** 




 The residency starts on
 **September 1st, 2025,** 
 and runs for
 **10 weeks** 
 ,
 **full-time** 
 ,
 **in-person in Stockholm** 
 . Any adjustments have to be agreed to in the interview process.
 



 Our residency program is fairly unstructured, with 90%+ of the time focused dedicated to founders working on their companies and making week-over-week progress. Here are some examples of things that founders focus on, depending on where they are at in their company journey:
 



  




* Find and vet potential cofounders
* Validate core assumptions around your business ideas and find meaningful market insight
* Build prototypes, find design partners, launch pilots, close customers
* Get feedback from functional experts and dedicated coaches
* Reach milestones that align with pre-seed funding



  





 If founders have already accomplished any of the above, they dedicate their full effort on the next most important milestones.
 



  





**Antler Investment Process** 



* At the end of the 10-week residency, you will have the opportunity to present to the Antler Investment Committee. If approved by the investment committee, you will receive a pre-seed commitment of
 **€400,000** 
 in two tranches. €100k for 10% and €300k in follow-on capital.
* Companies that receive investment at the end of the residency will join the Antler portfolio and gain even higher touch programming from our partners. This includes access our network of downstream investors, integration into the Antler Nordics portfolio and global portfolio network, and introductions to relevant partners and discounted service providers.



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is a early-stage VC that is changing the way people build companies. We operate in 30 locations worldwide, have supported 8,000+ founders through our residencies, and invested in 1500+ startups globally. We launched Antler to build a better on-ramp to venture capital. After working in venture-backed companies for years, we built Antler to provide founders with a structured and transparent process to successfully launch a new venture, a community for support throughout the experience, and a clear pathway to venture funding.
 



  





**Antler Highlights:** 




 Some examples of successful companies that were built as a result of Antler’s residency, received pre-seed investment from Antler, and have gone on to raise substantial investments are as follows:
 


* **Airalo:** 
 The world’s first eSIM subscription and top-up store
* **Wingbits** 
 : Incentive-based flight tracking platform
* **Treyd:** 
 Working capital operating system for B2B
* **Reebelo:** 
 Used electronics marketplace
* **Telgea:** 
 Global telecom operator
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software for identifying the best solar sites faster



  





**Cohort starts: September 1st, 2025, but we're working with founders all year round on an ad hoc basis.** 




  





**APPLY NOW**

title: Fullstack Developer in Quantum, Ai and Blockchain
description:
**Grow with us**
 Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
   

  

 Job Summary:
   

  

 Are you looking for an opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects involving blockchain, AI, and quantum computing? Do you enjoy a collaborative and innovative environment fostering rapid prototyping and experimentation with access to advanced tools and platforms for cloud-native development? Are you into career growth opportunities in a tech-forward organization? If you said yes, we might have a position for you!
   

  

 We are a team of altogether 17 people in Stockholm and Bangalore and are now seeking a dynamic and versatile Fullstack Developer to join our team in Stockholm Headquarters with expertise in developing scalable, cloud-native applications. The ideal candidate will have a passion for leveraging cutting-edge technologies like blockchain, AI, and quantum computing to drive rapid prototyping and innovation. This role demands a self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, Agile environment and can take ownership of end-to-end application development.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Fullstack Development: Build and maintain scalable web applications using Java, Spring Boot, and modern JavaScript frameworks (React/Angular).
* Blockchain Integration: Design and implement blockchain solutions, ensuring security, scalability, and performance.
* AI and Quantum Prototyping: Collaborate with AI and quantum computing teams to integrate intelligent and innovative solutions into applications.
* API Development: Develop RESTful and GraphQL APIs with secure and efficient authentication mechanisms, including PKI and certificate management.
* Cloud-Native Solutions: Build and deploy microservices using Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, and AWS-native services (API Gateway, Lambda, S3, RDS).
* Database Management: Design and optimize schemas, functions, and triggers for relational (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and NoSQL (MongoDB, InfluxDB) databases.
* DevSecOps: Ensure secure coding practices and integrate security into the CI/CD pipeline using tools like GitLab and Jira.
* UI Development: Create responsive, user-friendly UIs using React JS, HTML5, and CSS3.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with project goals and deliver rapid prototypes for evolving business needs.
* Performance Optimization: Conduct code reviews, performance tuning, and troubleshooting to ensure high-quality, efficient applications.


**Join our Team**
 Required Qualifications:
   

  

* Education: Minimum master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in fullstack development.
* Languages & Frameworks: Proficiency in Java (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud), JavaScript (React, Angular) and Go Lang.
* Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with AWS cloud-native applications, serverless computing, and distributed systems (EKS, Kafka, Redis).
* Database Skills: Strong understanding of relational and NoSQL databases, with experience in schema design and performance tuning.
* Blockchain & AI: Familiarity with blockchain technologies (e.g., Ethereum, Hyperledger) and AI tools/frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Quantum Computing: Basic understanding of quantum principles and experience with prototyping solutions leveraging quantum platforms.
* DevSecOps: Experience integrating security practices into CI/CD pipelines.
* Agile Development: Proven ability to deliver in an Agile environment, using tools like Jira and GitLab.
* UI Development: Expertise in building intuitive user interfaces with modern JavaScript frameworks.


 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

* Knowledge of big data platforms (e.g., Apache Spark, Databricks).
* Experience with Power BI and other data visualization tools.
* Strong scripting skills in Python or Shell in a Linux environment.
* Knowledge of containerization best practices and infrastructure automation.


 Skills & Competencies:
   

  

* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills to articulate technical solutions clearly.
* Strong understanding of secure coding practices and software architecture principles.
* Adaptable to rapidly changing technologies and business requirements.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Type: Full-Time
   

  

 Experience Level: Mid-Senior Level

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer
description:
IFS is a billion-dollar revenue company with 7000+ employees on all continents. Our leading AI technology is the backbone of our award-winning enterprise software solutions, enabling our customers to be their best when it really matters–at the Moment of Service™. Our commitment to internal AI adoption has allowed us to stay at the forefront of technological advancements, ensuring our colleagues can unlock their creativity and productivity, and our solutions are always cutting-edge.
   

  





 At IFS, we’re flexible, we’re innovative, and we’re focused not only on how we can engage with our customers but on how we can make a real change and have a worldwide impact. We help solve some of society’s greatest challenges, fostering a better future through our agility, collaboration, and trust.
   

  





 We celebrate diversity and understand our responsibility to reflect the diverse world we work in. We are committed to promoting an inclusive workforce that fully represents the many different cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints of our customers, our partners, and our communities. As a truly international company serving people from around the globe, we realize that our success is tantamount to the respect we have for those different points of view.
   

  





 By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be part of a
 **global, diverse environment;** 
 you will be joining a
 **winning team** 
 with a
 **commitment to sustainability;**
 and a company where we get things done so that you can
 **make a positive impact** 
 on the world.
   

  





 We’re looking for innovative and original thinkers to work in an environment where you can
 **#MakeYourMoment** 
 so that we can help others make theirs. With the power of our AI-driven solutions, we empower our team to change the status quo and make a real difference.
   

  





 If you want to change the status quo, we’ll help you make your moment. Join Team Purple. Join IFS.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are looking for a technical leader who is passionate about building scalable, resilient, and high-performance distributed systems. As the Lead Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and deployment of microservices architectures running on Kubernetes, driving both the technical vision and execution of our platform’s architecture.
   

  





**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  




* **Microservices Architecture** 
 : Design and implement scalable and high-performance microservices architectures that can handle increasing traffic and complex workloads.
* **Kubernetes & Containerization** 
 : Lead the architecture, deployment, and management of containerized applications using Kubernetes, ensuring they are highly available, scalable, and resilient.
* **System Scalability** 
 : Ensure that the systems are designed for horizontal scalability and can handle large volumes of traffic by effectively utilizing Kubernetes and container orchestration tools.
* **Continuous Improvement** 
 : Drive the adoption of best practices and improve existing microservices, systems, and workflows to enhance system performance, reliability, and efficiency.
* **Mentorship & Leadership** 
 : Provide leadership and mentorship to engineering teams, helping to develop junior and mid-level engineers by fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Work closely with product managers, designers, and other engineering teams to deliver robust, production-ready solutions that meet business goals.
* **DevOps & CI/CD** 
 : Own and lead efforts in automation of the development lifecycle, ensuring efficient deployment processes and effective use of CI/CD pipelines in a Kubernetes environment.
* **Troubleshooting & Debugging** 
 : Lead efforts in identifying, diagnosing, and resolving issues across distributed systems, ensuring system uptime and availability.
* **Security & Compliance** 
 : Implement and ensure that microservices are secure, scalable, and compliant with relevant industry standards.
* **Innovation** 
 : Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in microservices, Kubernetes, and distributed systems, applying new tools and techniques to improve our platform.


**Qualifications**

**Required Qualifications** 
 :
   

  




* **Experience** 
 : 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 2 years of specialized experience in designing, implementing, and managing microservices architectures.
* **Expertise in Microservices** 
 : Strong experience designing and developing microservices-based applications and distributed systems.
* **Kubernetes & Containers** 
 : Deep expertise in Kubernetes, Docker, and container orchestration. Proficient in deploying, managing, and scaling applications in Kubernetes clusters.
* **Cloud Platforms** 
 : Proficiency with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure, with hands-on experience deploying and managing containerized applications.
* **Programming Skills** 
 : Strong coding experience in languages such as Java, or Go with an emphasis on writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
* **API Design & Development** 
 : Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, gRPC, and asynchronous messaging (Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
* **CI/CD & DevOps** 
 : Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, automation, and DevOps practices. Familiarity with tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, Helm, and Terraform.
* **Monitoring & Logging** 
 : Familiarity with monitoring and logging solutions (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, etc.) to ensure the health and performance of Kubernetes-based systems.
* **Leadership Skills** 
 : Proven ability to lead and mentor engineering teams, driving projects to completion while fostering a collaborative, innovative, and high-performance environment.
* **Problem-Solving** 
 : Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical challenges in a distributed environment.



**Preferred Qualifications** 
 :
   

  




* **Cloud-Native Technologies** 
 : Familiarity with cloud-native tools and ecosystems such as service meshes (Istio, Linkerd), Helm charts, and Kubernetes Operators.
* **Microservices Frameworks** 
 : Experience with frameworks and tools that facilitate microservices architecture, such as Spring Boot, Micronaut, or similar.
* **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** 
 : Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
* **Distributed Tracing** 
 : Experience with distributed tracing tools like Jaeger or OpenTelemetry for debugging microservices.
* **Security** 
 : Strong knowledge of securing microservices, Kubernetes clusters, and cloud-based applications.


**Additional Information**

*We believe that coming together as a community, in person, is important for innovation, connection and fostering a sense of belonging. Our roles have the right balance of remote and in-office working to enable flexibility for managing your life along with ensuring a real connection with your colleagues and the broader IFS community.*

title: SVT söker systemspecialist för Microsoft
description:
**Vad Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Hos oss på SVT får du arbeta i en kreativ miljö med engagerade kollegor. Du får vara med i spännande projekt och initiativ som driver vår digitaliseringsresa framåt. Vi erbjuder en varierande och händelserik vardag på ett av Sveriges mest kända varumärken.
   

  

**Vad Den Här Tjänsten Innebär**
 Du kommer att driva utvecklingsinitiativ kring Microsoft inom IT på SVT. Du ansvarar för att förvalta och uppgradera våra Microsoftprodukter, samt fånga in verksamhetens behov och krav för att optimera våra arbetssätt. Du samarbetar nära med interna och externa partners och nyckelfunktioner inom SVT.
   

  

**Vem Vi Tror Att Du Är**
 Du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik/IT/system och datavetenskap samt några års erfarenhet inom IT/teknisk support eller projektledning. Du är serviceinriktad, driven och har god samarbetsförmåga. Du uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Ska Krav**
* Drivit utvecklingsinitiativ kring Microsoft
* Arbetat med AI-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av Power Platform, Dataverse, Azure AD, Active Directory, Microsoft Endpoint Manager, licens- och användaradministration
* Bygga low-code-lösningar med Power Platform
* Integrera affärsprocesser med Power Platform och Dataverse
* Grundläggande förståelse för API:er och datakopplingar


**Hur Du Ansöker**
 Vi använder urvalsfrågor och CV istället för personligt brev. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 20 maj. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Stockholm. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då tjänsten kan placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Annat Som Är Bra Att Veta**
 Har du frågor? Kontakta Catarina Norlén, gruppchef Teknisk support och PST, via mejl catarina.norlen@svt.se. Fackliga frågor besvaras av Maria Nassikas Unionen, Jonas Ohlsson SJF och Fanny Lindhé SACO via växeln 08-784 00 00.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: R&D Engineer
description:
**R&D Engineer**
================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


R&D Department Lead

### **Your role and responsibilities**


In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to ABB’s success with technology, software, product, and system development. Each day, you will identify and implement innovative solutions to relevant problems. You will also showcase your expertise by providing ideas and by being able to work both independently and as a part of a Research & Development (R&D) team. You will be mainly accountable for: •Responsibility for configuration management towards hardware and firmware projects •Working as an independent and reliable contributor in R&D projects with limited supervision. •Driving the achievement of assigned targets (quality, time, scope, cost) and raising and addressing risks.


### **Qualifications for the role**

* You have a couple of years of experience in configuration management and preferably have worked with embedded electronics, hardware and software products
* Can handle several projects in parallel supporting in different configuration management topics.
* You are at ease communicating in English

### **More about us**


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Energy Engineer
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

  


**Job Summary**
---------------



The Factory Sustainable Solution team, part of Business Sector Key Components, Plant Solutions & Channel Management in Processing Equipment AB, is recruiting an Energy Engineer. The position is located in Lund, Sweden.


**What you will do**
--------------------



By offering optimised energy solutions on factory or line level we enable our customers to reduce their environmental footprint while also reducing their utility costs. The Centre of Expertise is responsible for the full factory understanding with regards to heat recovery and energy balance as well as water, wastewater management and CIP optimisation.

  


We are seeking a talented and motivated Energy Engineer to join our dynamic team. Practical experience in combination with a University degree is an advantage.

  


As an Energy Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and developing tailored energy and utility systems, including solar thermal, heat pumps and refrigeration units. You will conduct comprehensive energy assessments to identify opportunities for efficiency improvements and create competitive solutions that optimize performance and improve Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). You will collaborate closely with customers to understand their needs and provide customized solutions, preparing and presenting detailed proposals and quotations. Staying updated on industry trends and best practices will be essential to your role.

  


* Offer optimized solutions to reduce environmental footprint and utility costs.
* Design and develop tailored energy and utility systems, including heat pumps and refrigeration units.
* Conduct energy assessments to identify efficiency improvements.
* Create competitive solutions to optimize performance and improve Total Cost of Ownership (TCO).
* Collaborate with customer to understand their needs and provide customized solutions.
* Prepare and present detailed proposals and quotations.
* Work closely with the Project Organization and other stakeholders.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices.
**We believe you have**
-----------------------


* University degree in Chemical Engineering Unit Operations, Mechanical Engineering, Energy Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience as an Energy Consultant or similar.
* Strong knowledge of energy assessment techniques and tools.
* Proven experience in designing energy utility systems, including heat pumps and refrigeration plants.
* Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance.
* Knowledge of steam systems and unit operations.
* Proficiency in relevant software for Process Flow Diagrams and P&IDs.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and negotiation skills.
* Ability to
	+ create detailed and compelling proposals and quotations.
	+ work independently and as part of a team.
	+ travel for customer meetings and site assessments
**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  




**Apply Now**


If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.


This job posting expires on **2025-05-21.**


To know more about the position contact the Hiring Manager Andreas Ronnfors at +46 46 36 1554  

Questions about your application contact the Recruiter Rita Nécsei at +3623885380


For trade union information, contact Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320 and Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*
company_description: At Tetra Pak we like a good challenge, and our promise is to make food safe and available everywhere.

title: Electronics Engineer at Evolved Aerospace
description:
**Location:** Linköping, Sweden Scope: Full-time
  
Want to help build the brains and nerves behind some of the world’s most advanced drones? Evolved Aerospace isn’t your average tech company – they’re fast, fearless, and already delivering life-saving UAS technology to Ukraine. Now they’re looking for an experienced electronics engineer who’s ready to bring theory to life — and help power the next generation of unmanned aerial systems.
  
About Evolved Aerospace Evolved Aerospace is the Swedish branch of a fast-moving international defense tech group originally founded in the United States. With active operations in the US, Sweden, and Ukraine - and global partners across Europe, Asia, and South America – Evolved designs and delivers next-generation unmanned aerial systems (UAS) for defense and dual-use applications.
  
In just a short time, the Swedish team has gone from zero to battlefield impact. Their drones are already flying real missions, and the development cycles are measured in months – not years. It’s the best of both worlds: startup agility meets serious defense-grade engineering. And they’re just getting started.
  
Who We’re Looking For We’re looking for a senior electronics engineer who’s as comfortable building and testing as they are designing and leading. You combine deep technical expertise in electronics and embedded systems with a practical, hands-on mindset. You’re a doer — someone who takes initiative, solves problems across disciplines, and thrives in environments where the stakes are high and the timelines are tight.
  
You care about quality, but you also move fast. You’re driven by impact, energized by challenge, and you understand how your work fits into the bigger picture.
  
About the Role This is not a standard electronics job. At Evolved, you’ll work across the full lifecycle — from concept to flight — developing and integrating cutting-edge electronics into high-performance UAS platforms.
  
  

**You’ll:**  

Design and implement electronic systems, including power, communication, and control modules
  
Integrate sensors, radio systems, and embedded controllers into real flying platforms
  
Test, troubleshoot, and verify electronics in both lab and real-world flight conditions
  
Work closely with mechanical, software, and systems engineers to ensure seamless integration
  
Lead documentation, quality assurance, and continuous improvement of electronic systems
  
  

Qualifications
  
Degree in electronics, embedded systems, or a related field
  
At least 7+ years of relevant experience, including leadership in technical roles
  
Deep knowledge of electronics, embedded systems, and control engineering
  
Proficiency in PCB design, schematic layout, and hands-on build/test work
  
Experience taking products from prototype to production
  
Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus)
  
  

Why Join Evolved? Because you want to build something that matters. You want speed, ownership, and the chance to work with sharp people solving hard problems. At Evolved, you won’t be a cog in a giant machine – you’ll be part of the core team that’s designing and deploying real systems for real missions.
  
They offer competitive salaries, wellness benefits, and a profit-sharing model where up to 15% of annual profit is distributed across the team. But more importantly? They offer purpose, autonomy, and a chance to grow like never before. If you're chasing comfort, this isn't your gig. But if you're driven by impact, innovation, and the thrill of getting tech into the air — you're in the right place.
  
We look forward to receiving your application! The recruitment process is managed by Ed: Za Group. If you have any questions regarding the position or the process, please don’t hesitate to contact Tyra Nguyen at tyra.nguyen@edzagroup.se.

title: FPGA Engineer at Evolved Aerospace
description:
**Location:** Linköping, Sweden Scope: Full-time, hybrid
  
Want to build advanced sensor systems that fly, detect, defend – and make a real-world impact? Evolved Aerospace isn’t your average tech company – they’re fast, fearless, and already delivering life-saving drone technology to Ukraine. Now they’re looking for a self-driven FPGA engineer to join their expert team and help develop high-performance embedded systems for both current missions and the future of autonomous flight.
  
About Evolved Aerospace Evolved Aerospace is the Swedish branch of a fast-moving international defense tech group originally founded in the United States. With active operations in the US, Sweden, and Ukraine - and global partners across Europe, Asia, and South America – Evolved designs and delivers next-generation unmanned aerial systems (UAS) for defense and dual-use applications.
  
In just a short time, the Swedish team has gone from zero to battlefield impact. Their drones are already flying real missions, and the development cycles are measured in months – not years. It’s the best of both worlds: startup agility meets serious defense-grade engineering. And they’re just getting started.
  
Who We’re Looking For We’re looking for an experienced FPGA engineer who’s both a generalist and a specialist — someone who loves working close to the hardware, solving complex signal-processing challenges, and turning theory into working tech.
  
You’re hands-on, highly motivated, and comfortable working across domains. You thrive in high-stakes, fast-moving environments and enjoy collaborating with sharp peers to create real, deployable systems. You bring deep expertise in FPGA toolchains, a strong sense for how things work under the hood, and a desire to build systems that fly and matter.
  
About the Role This is not a typical firmware job. You’ll be developing advanced embedded systems based on FPGAs, working with signal and image processing at high speed, and contributing to everything from board-level design to system architecture. Your work will directly power critical airborne platforms used in defense and humanitarian missions.
  
  

**You’ll:**  

Design and implement DSP and real-time image processing pipelines in FPGAs
  
Work hands-on with the AMD-Xilinx toolchain (Vivado, Vitis, etc.)
  
Collaborate across teams to integrate your solutions with flight systems and onboard software
  
Contribute to board-level specification and design when needed
  
Support system architecture, firmware design, and AI-related implementation
  
  

Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, computer science, or similar
  
Proven experience in FPGA-based embedded systems development
  
Solid knowledge of DSP algorithms and real-time processing
  
Proficient in Verilog or VHDL
  
Experience with AMD-Xilinx or Altera toolchains (Vivado, Quartus, etc.)
  
Understanding of ARM architecture and integration
  
Strong debugging and problem-solving skills
  
  

**Bonus:** Experience with AI implementation, board-level design, or mission-critical systems
  
Why Join Evolved? Because you want to build something that matters. You want speed, ownership, and the chance to work with sharp people solving hard problems. At Evolved, you won’t be a cog in a giant machine – you’ll be part of the core team that’s designing and deploying real systems for real missions.
  
They offer competitive salaries, wellness benefits, and a profit-sharing model where up to 15% of annual profit is distributed across the team. But more importantly?
